Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to pacify my wife. I have the big brother D600 with expensive lenses, and she felt left out, so I got her this. I am an avid photographer, she is along for the ride. Basically she wanted a camera with a view finder and manual operation as well as auto controls, and the P510 met the requirements. Having owned other Nikon compacts I knew the P510 would take great photographs, but I felt it was no match for my outfit. We went out to a wildlife preserve to photograph birds. I set up by camera on its stable tripod, 300mm prime lens, tuned in the optimal exposure and composition, and took my best shots. Meanwhile she was shooting out the window, or walking around snapping at whatever presented itself. When we got home I loaded both sets of pictures and knew right away I was in trouble. She caught the detailed orange eyes of a sandhill crane, I did not. She caught the windblown feather detail of a yellow headed blackbird, I did not. We will be printing some of her photographs to hang on the wall, there will be none of mine. With a lighter and more agile camera she was able to take advantage of the moment while I was stuck on the tripod. Lesson learned. All I got to say is Wow!. I would recommend this camera for anybody who wants a compact camera without the lens bag, and full auto or full manual or anything in between. I would even recommend it as an accessory for a more advanced photographer so they can see what the shot should have looked like.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: JaxGirl2000 "JaxGirl2000"
Reviews.Content: I am still discovering all of the awesome features on this camera and having so much fun with it. I recommend purchasing the Photographer's Guide to the Nikon COOLPIX P510 by Alexander S. White because it explains all of the features in detail. If you are looking for a camera to take quick photos at a party, etc. this camera would be a waste. If you enjoy photography and want to produce better photographs this would be my recommendation. The superzoom is amazing; I took photos of weeds that had tiny flowers and the zoom captured every detail including the minuscule dew drops on the petals. I look at weeds differently now! Even more fun is the Pet Portrait feature. Just select this mode, point the camera at your pet and when it finds the face it focuses AND takes the picture! No more blurred shots with my kitty looking the other way. I started using this camera on a tripod because I have trouble holding still when I take a photo but it has motion detection and vibration reduction that assist in getting clear shots. The viewfinder displays all of the menu items and shows focus and zoom activity so there is no need to use the display screen to take photos. I love this feature because I can take a picture in bright sunlight and stabilize the camera better. The display screen is not always visible in bright light outside but it is movable and can be adjusted for difficult-angled shots. Great camera with awesome features, lightweight, great battery life and very easy to use. Maybe not a choice for a professional because you can't change lenses, add filters or add a flash but it is wonderful for someone like myself who wants to learn to take better pictures without having to take classes; the results are immediate. Great Nikon website too with lots of articles on taking photos.

Reviews.Title: My only regret: I didn't buy it sooner
Reviews.Author: D. Rodrigues "I'd rather be cycling"
Reviews.Content: I have owned many point and shoot digital camera's over the years and for the most part, I've gotten good results from models like the Canon Powershot. That said, this camera takes you to an entirely new level of photography. As everyone notes, the 42x zoom is amazing. What impressed me is that even at extreme magnification, the quality of the image is very high. If you like taking pictures of wildlife, you'll be in heaven. Please note that the manual that comes in the box is not the same as the manual on the CD ROM. The digital manual is the full manual (something like 260 pages.) There are many features you can explore with this camera. What I do is try and learn one or two new things each day by making my way through the manual. There are also a few YouTube videos out there with some tips on how to use it. If you need some art work for you walls, try some of the cool special effect features and you can create some truly artistic looking images. Regarding memory - I got a 32 Meg chip which holds about 6800 images! The bottom line is you are getting enormous value with this product. I'd buy it again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: Very Well Done!
Reviews.Author: Bookman
Reviews.Content: Some people have complained about various aspects of the Coolpix P150 but honestly i don't understand where they are coming from. Like most people I have had numerous cameras, the last being a Pentax-K DSLR. This Nikon is superior in every way and it's not a DSLR!!! How many gadgets does the average photographer need? This is easy to set up, easy to use and I personally think the pictures are great. Good color, sharp and clear. The telephoto is unreal and it's built right in so no changing lens and dragging around extra junk. It is so easy to use that if you can't figure this one out you need a Brownie Box camera from the 50's.I spent days going back and forth between Sony, Cannon and Nikon. Boy am I glad I chose this one.I would recommend this with our hesitation. Simpler is better unless you are a pro and they do most of their editing with software, not the camera.You want an excellent camera? This is it.

Reviews.Title: Nice - sports shots still blurry
Reviews.Author: colleen
Reviews.Content: I really have enjoyed this camera.  I bought it primarily because my daughter is active in both high school volleyball and basketball.  I was looking for a camera that I could get some decent action shots without them being a big blur.  This camera has the ability to shoot with the 5 continuous shots and I thought that might work.  it does, occasionally.  It also could be the operator.  Still playing with all the adjustments so it is possible that there are settings other than the sport shooting setting that will get me my desired result.  Other than that the pictures are clear and crisp and I like that I can adjust the LCD view screen to different angles.  It comes in handy at times.  Has an excellent zoom.  All in all I am happy with the camera as I have always been in the past with Nikon products.

Reviews.Title: Incredible!!!
Reviews.Author: F. Miller "Puppy"
Reviews.Content: Just got this camera for my Galapagos trip and I can't believe my own eyes. We took phenomenal pictures. We love the camera and so many options which are so simple . The 42x zoom is out of this world for wild life. A MUST!

Reviews.Title: very good camera
Reviews.Author: JAL001
Reviews.Content: I've had the P510 about 2 weeks. I've taken very good hand-held 1000mm zoom shots with no visible blurring. Very impressed with overall quality and value. I've been waiting for more than 1 year for a super-zoom camera with the focal range and features the P510 has. The P510 makes a great backup or even primary camera to my D90. I shoot mostly wildlife, landscape and macro. I recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Excellent 42x zoom for a point n' shoot
Reviews.Author: Algi "Al"
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased this camera for a trip that I just completed, whichrequired frequent use of a zoom lens.I posted the 42x zoom pictures of a model rail road diorama taken at the Vilnius Lithuaniarail road museum.My last Nikon camera was the venerable Nikon F, which I still have.The advent of 'point & shoot' cameras captured my more recent 'devotion' dueto the relative simplicity of use, paid for by loss of functionality.The pictures speak for themselves, I am very satisfied with the qualityof the pictures. The AF system worked flawlessly and quickly, all of mypictures were taken on the fly, without the use of a tripod...I will confirm the reports of battery depletion, often without muchwarning, usually after taking video images.I heeded the warnings on the Amazon and other camera site reviews andpurchased backup batteries to carry with.Overall I am very impressed with my selection of the p510 in candy apple red, return to the Nikon brand.

Reviews.Title: Trish
Reviews.Author: PEM
Reviews.Content: This Camera is just what I was looking for.  It takes great pictures. It zooms out for far shots and has settings to cover any lighting situation.  It comes with an instructional CD which makes it easy to use.  The viewer raises and lowers depending on the angle you want to look at your shot or to view your pictures. I am very pleased with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Good pix, exceptionally poor geotagging
Reviews.Author: Demoncrat
Reviews.Content: I've had the camera for about 2 months now, with enough time to evaluate some aspects of it thoroughly. The picture quality is good, the operation is relatively simple. The battery life is not so good. Where it really doesn't live up to its billing is in its GPS capabilities. I got it because I've started using geotagging on my website, and thought that it would be an advance from my current technology (Sony F828 with a separate GPS logger, and software to marry the two). It isn't. The GPS often takes a very long time to lock on to its position, even when it has already found that position and the camera just went to sleep. As a result, many fotos do not have GPS info inserted into them automatically when they're taken. The GPS logging system is, to put it kindly, pathetic. I recently went on 2-week trip, and set the logging system to log for 12 hours every day, and saved the log files. Of the fourteen files that were created, five were corrupt and wouldn't load into my geotagging app. Of the ones which loaded, many had corrupt locations, with 3-digit degrees of longitude followed by 5-digit minutes of longitude entries (that's 5 digits with an additional 2 digits following the decimal point). That certainly is non-standard. When displayed on a map, they are 50 and 60 miles away from the location where the foto was taken. My cellphone (Nokia N8) has a better geotagging capability than this camera, and nearly as good picture quality. After having just spent $400 for this camera, I'm already ready to trade it in for the next one. And not from Nikon.

Reviews.Title: Without a doubt, the best non-DSLR camera I've ever bought.
Reviews.Author: Marilyn Burton
Reviews.Content: I'm a professional photographer and I bought this after buying the Canon SX40, which I gave away!  I gave the SX40 to my husband because I did not like the camera at all.  I currently own 3 Nikon DSLR camera bodies (D330S, D600, and D800) along with 5 lenses to go with those cameras. I also like to have a simple point and shoot camera for everyday stuff.  I bought the Canon to replace an older point and shoot camera.  The Canon had a 35x zoom but the quality of the photos were inferior.  For example, on sunsets, the camera didn't have a sunsett setting because the camera was supposed to sense the orange and pink colors in the sky and know what to do.  But it didn't.  In fact, it tried to compensate for the darkening sky and overlit the photo.  The sunset photos were too light and some were even washed out.  Within a short time of owning that Canon, I looked at the Nikon CoolPix and chose the P510, even the there was a newer model.  It has 42x zoom which is fantastic.  The photos are wonderful, too - not the quality of my DSLR's but considering the cost, the quality is wonderful.  I would highly recommend this for the amateur photographer.  The video is great too.  This is the perfect camera for a new parent because you can get snapshots and videos.  First steps, first swimming lessons, first attempts at talking, first haircut. Lot of precious moments to video and you don't have to change the setting (although you can if you want).  There is a red button on the back of the camera.  If you push it, it starts to record video.  Push it again to stop.  This camera allows you to zoom in or out during video.  Some cameras do not let you do that.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful pictures, incredible zoom, light on the wallet
Reviews.Author: Nathan1981
Reviews.Content: For the price, you're not going to find a much better camera.  The zoom lets you really get up close to something without having to lug an enormous camera lens attachment kit with you.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera
Reviews.Author: Judi Vaughn
Reviews.Content: We used this in Canada on a cruise.  So being on a ship you cannot get too close to the land items of interest.  We could zoom in and get unbelievable crisp clear pictures with this camera.  I expect this to be the last camera I will ever purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great zoom but a little tough to navigate the menu options
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey L. Foster "kidphoto"
Reviews.Content: After 35 years experience with various styles and brands of cameras (everything from full manual SLR to instamatics to medium format to full auto programmed SLR to various digital Point&Shoots; to full DSLR, Pentax, Fuji, Canon, Olympus, Ricoh) this is my first Nikon, as i have never quite felt comfortable with their user interface at any time.  Bought this to supplement my stable of Canon DSLRs, and small pocket Fuji Point-Shoots, and Pentax waterproof  cameras.  Excellent pictures so far but I have always found the menu navigation on Nikons to be less than intuitive, and this is no exception.  There are easily changed basic settings for full auto, programmed (not sure what the difference is there), aperture and shutter priority, as well as several landscape modes, but no portrait or fast sports presets.  The latter on most cameras optimizes shutter speeds and usually gives you rapid fire multi-frames per second if you hold the exposure button down.  On this camera I have found full programmed auto to give highest shutter speeds in general, but have to negotiate the menus to get multi frame exposures added to it.  Long tele capability is what sold me on this camera, in lieu of carrying extra lenses with my DSLRs, but the controls are a bit clumsy and not so intuitive or versatile.  Also there is a nearly one second lag in exposure after pressing button, then at least another second or two between that image and the ability to take another, unless in rapidfire mode.  Digital video is clean and crisp, and only takes one button to turn on from back of camera, but again controls are not so intuitive and I found myself video-ing my lap several times while figured them out.  Lens cap pops off every time I turn off the camera.  Viewfinder is the default display, requiring a back side button to switch to screen display which is nicely mobile but not very hi res.  and you can only have one or the other on at a time.All in all a capable camera with great built in long zoom, but IMHO a clumsy and difficult control interface compared to others I have worked with.  Shutter lag, lack of a rapid fire sports quick setting,  and a few other settings have been a disappointment .  Clearly an oversized P&S; that wants to be a DSLR but falls short a bit on both accounts.  Seems best suited for landscapes and slow movement point and shoot situations, leave more challenging situations to the DSLRs IMHO.  A bit pricey for its shortfalls, although the metallic red finish sure does look pretty.

Reviews.Title: Convenient travel alternative...
Reviews.Author: Marcia Bunchman "Marcia"
Reviews.Content: Let me say first, that I love my D700, however, it it heavy, especially when toting 2 or 3 lenses.  In fact, my camera bag weighs over 28 pounds.  I didn't buy the D510 to replace my D700, but, to offer a  convenient alternative.  I am currently touring Turkey and bought this camera especially for this trip.  I have taken great pictures with this camera.  I love the three focusing options, the light weight, and the ability use a view finder.  (Many cameras in this price range do not offer the alternative to use the view finder or the viewer on the back).  The one downside is the battery....it doesn't last as long as I would like and the only way to charge it is in the camera.  So, if you want to keep shooting with a second battery, you can't charge the first battery without having it in the camera.  That said, I charged 3 batteries before leaving the US and charge them as I need to at night.  You really need a 2nd or 3rd battery backup.Added to the review...May 13, 2013.  I just returned from Peru and carried this camera everywhere.  It took great pictures.  If you reach the far end of the zoom, it is hard to  get it to focus.  Also it is not the best for action (sports, etc)shots, but, for travel, it is awesome....I am so happy I bought this.

Reviews.Title: Travel Camera
Reviews.Author: Jimmakat
Reviews.Content: This camera has good resolution 16 mp and excellent zoom range. It is small and lightweight. No need for extra lenses. The monitor screen allows for low and high shooting but will not swing around for self portraits. Flash is adequate for general photography. Video is easy to start and stop. You can start using it out of the box - just drop in the battery and if you have one, a memory card. Set on "P" turn on and shoot. Camera does focusing and exposure control. Wide range in lighting conditions.If you still want to bother, read the operating manual.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: DB
Reviews.Content: I love this camera!  I was looking for an inexpensive camera that was easy to use.  I found it.  I need a camera that does not require changing lenses that will cover a wide range of distances and I found it.  I wanted a camera that took great pictures and If the one shot I wanted to blow up to put on the wall would have great resolution I found it.  I asked around and professional photographers were steering me towards $800 - $1500 cameras that need different lenses and the knowledge of a professional to use it.  I took a picture of the mountains right out of the box in auto mode and it met all my expectations.  It light weight, easy to handle. I highly recommend this to all of you that like taking pictures but not up for the apertures openings, shutter speed, calculations of setting the professional cameras up to snap a picture.  However it does look like if I ever take the plunge to learn these settings this camera will allow me to do that.

Reviews.Title: Just a little bit off.
Reviews.Author: Kaleidocherry
Reviews.Content: I've been researching cameras for about a month now and actually bought and returned the Sony NEX-7 (couldn't justify the price) and the Pentax Q (picture quality no better than my old point & shoot).  But this one kept coming up near the top of ranking lists.  I picked it up locally yesterday for the same price as Amazon and have been fiddling with it nearly nonstop.  It's a great camera!  I have big problems trying to achieve focus at long zooms, but that may be my fault for not being steady-handed.  The only real problem I have with it is that looking through the viewfinder gets me nothing but a smear of dim light.  I've turned the dial on it, aimed it directly at bright light, opened the flash, all sorts of things, but everything in it is just unfocused blobs of dark and darker colors.  But this doesn't matter since as a glasses wearer, I can't use a viewfinder anyway.  (Can't focus on anything after taking my eye away from the viewfinder.)  I've taken several shots of my rose garden from about 50' away, while seated at my desk, through the window glass, and they look great.  I've taken extreme macro shots of figurines and cats.  They look great.  I like everything about this camera except the viewfinder problem (ultimately a non-issue) and the fact that Nikon doesn't make a nice case for it.  I found an Etsy seller who will custom-make a neoprene sleeve for it, so I went that route.Oh, one more little thing.  Sometimes I can't get even "near" focus when I'm trying to zoom in on something within, say, 10 feet.  (Cat's face, distant figurines, whatever.)  But this may be operator error and I'm not willing to knock another star off for that.Edit:  I found out about the viewfinder.  There's a little button right next to it which toggles between the LCD screen and the viewfinder.  You can't have both on at the same time.  But that's all right with me.

Reviews.Title: Not bad for a mid-range camera
Reviews.Author: Johnny S Young
Reviews.Content: I like the wieght & feel of this Camera; not heavy yet sturdy when held.  It takes really great pictures albeit a learning curve takes a while.  This is not a "point & shoot" type; it is packed with advanced features like GPS, zooom factors and the like. I advise to take a particular interest in the shooting modes, lighting and scene selections and make use of the menu button. I found this very helpful under different lighting conditions.  The fold-out & tilt anglel of the monitor is really nice but be careful not to extend it too much. I haven't used the HD / movie part yet, but what I've read from teh CD this camera should produce awesome results. It is adviseable to read the manual and afterward, study in the enclosed CD more details.

Reviews.Title: Only had it a couple of days, but so far it's great (bought refurbished one).
Reviews.Author: J. Herzo "BargainZFinder2009"
Reviews.Content: So, I ordered the refurbished one from Cameta because I didn't quite have enough for the new price and all the accessories I wanted, so I bought it refurbished and hoped for the best.It arrived earlier than expected (date range given was 3-8th October, arrived on the 2nd), it was very well packaged and well packaged by Nikon who had refurbished it. The camera looked brand new to me - not a single mark on it and I checked it thoroughly with a fine tooth comb so to speak as I knew it was refurbished. It came with the lens cap and strap, neck strap for camera, 2 disks with software and instruction manual on them, a Nikon battery and the camera itself, plus a small booklet too.It was so easy to set up for first use (I already had bought a quick battery charger from Amazon and that came with a battery so I was able to get it working instantly as the charger arrived the day before).Took some regular photos, took some great zoom photos and some video too. Was VERY impressed with the video - the quality of it is so much better than my old camera and better than my iPhone by a long way, you can also zoom while videoing and there isn't that horribly loud zooming sound you get on a lot of cameras.I have only used the auto features so far, will update the review once I use a few other features and take some scenic shots, but so far I am very pleased with this camera and I'm glad I took a chance on a refurbished one too, there is no way to tell it isn't new!**UPDATE** I love this camera! Took it to Disneyland and got some great night and day shots, the zoom really helped as it was very busy there. Also got some fantastic videos over Christmas and this refurbished model is working great. I can highly recommend buying from Cameta as they really do sell a quality "used / refurbished" product and they shipped fast too.

Reviews.Title: Is this really a Nikon?
Reviews.Author: Thomas
Reviews.Content: The zoom is great but, the thing goes out of focus constantly. The reviews I read did not mention that fact. This is my second one. I dropped the last one on a concrete floor and broke the zoom. I do home inspections and it is very useful for getting wide angle shots of rooms and, close ups of things like bricks on chimneys. Unfortunately, for no reason that I know of, it stops focusing. I will go back to my office and download the images only to find that a series of pictures are all blurry. I had a Olympus ultra zoom before this and it was much more reliable. The name Nikon is losing it's luster.

Reviews.Title: $ FOR $ THIS CAMERA IS THE BEST OF ITS KIND
Reviews.Author: Nelson E. Donley
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for about 3 weeks and have no regrets about buying it. The 42x zoom is phenomenal. I can take a picture of a license plate over 100 yards away and it looks as though I'm standing directly behind the car. The video is magnificent. I posted videos on my web cloud & many of my friends asked what kind of camera I was using. The picture & audio was just that awesome. Still pictures look as though they were taken with an expensive SLR even in very low light. The camera is very easy to use. Unless you choose to do things manually, it's fully automatic & will not let you down. 16.1 MP is much more pixel power than I will ever need. I don't plan on blowing up a photo the size of a barn door. The only thing I find lacking on this camera is that its shutter speed isn't as fast as the Fuji. It's plenty fast enough for me. The display monitor folds out & can be set at any angle, which makes picture taking a lot easier.The problem with many of the reviews on Amazon is that some people are just plain anal. These people ought to go back to film and do their own developing in a darkroom. I had to choose from 3 other brands; Fuji, Panasonic, and Canon. Any of these cameras (in this price range) would have been fine. I chose the Nikon mainly for 4 reasons: 1. The 42x zoom works remarkably well. 2. The camera feels well in my hands & is easy to use. 3. The video is first rate. 4. Nikon is a name you can trust. It's the camera Paul Simon mentions by name in his song "Kodachrome" and that was a great song!

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix P510, I think I love you!!
Reviews.Author: WK Barley "barleyfamilyaz"
Reviews.Content: This Camera has exceeded all my expectations, and I have barely used it. I had done a bit of hurried research online before an impending trip to Mexico, since I needed a good camera, under $500, and fast. I've always been a fan of Nikon, going back to the old FM I had back in the day. Since then, I've had a succession of 35mm SLR cameras: Minoltas, Oympus, and Canon. I was pretty stuck on Canon when I purchased my first digital SLR, the EOS Rebel T3. I was happy with this camera, it being reasonably priced and having some nice features. Then, I dropped it. So, long story short, went back to using the equivalent Canon 35mm until I could justify spending $300+ on a new camera. Fast forward to present day. I purchased the Nikon Coolpix P510 through Amazon, had it the very next day thanks to the stock held here in Phoenix. Testing went well, but the trip was nigh, so no more messing about. Features I've tried out so far, Scene Selection, HD Video, sport mode, close-up, and moveable display screen. Just scratched the surface. Used the video while on a whale watching tour, worked terrific. The boat was moving so much that I found it nearly impossible to take still photos, but will have to try that again. Some success with sport mode, but again, too much movement to really know what it's capable of. Close-up is simply amazing. I had the opportunity to visit the local botanical gardens in Puerto Vallarta, and the Orchids just scream for close ups. The clarity is amazing. I love the design of the display screen, how it has various positions that let you hold the camera where you need to. To be honest, I've only read a few pages of the instruction booklet, so I can only imagine what else this baby can do.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic except for one feature
Reviews.Author: Paula E-F
Reviews.Content: Overall I am satisfied with the Nikon Coolpix P510. My last two cameras were Canons so this was a jump for me. The quality of the photos is stellar. One reason I bought the camera was the zoom lens because I enjoy photographing birds and animals that frequent our woods. Quite often I am shooting through a window.  Even so, the detail on these photographs is simply phenomenal.  On the birds you can see tiny individual feathers with clarity.  There are details I have never been able to capture on previous cameras.The feature that annoys me is that the self-timer only takes one shot and then reverts back to regular mode. I can't think of a single instance when using a self-timer that I have only taken one shot. When you have a group of people, as we did at Christmas, re-setting the self timer after every group shot was a major nuisance. I have investigated the menus on the Nikon and cannot find an option to change this. On my previous cameras it would stay in the self timing mode until it turned off or you changed it back. If anyone knows of a way to reset this feature I would appreciate learning about it.

Reviews.Title: Very good 1000 mm telephoto, Incredible Image Stabilization
Reviews.Author: Robert Rush "RobBob"
Reviews.Content: I have been using the Nikon P510 daily for about 6 months. There are a few things I really like about the camera, quite a few things I don't like (or could certainly be better), and a few things that should be included.I have been using digital photography for about the last 15 years, and digital exclusively for about the last 6 years. I have a DSLR and an assortment of lenses, I needed a really long zoom and was considering lenses in the several thousand dollar range, when it occurred to me that maybe a newer generation superzoom might be a cheaper (and lighter) way to go. Before purchasing this camera, I tried the FujiFilm HS30EXR, X-S1 and Lumix FZ150, each for about 2 weeks thanks to Amazon Prime. Although, I loved the Fuji cameras, their image quality  and image stabilization was not as good as the Nikon or Lumix. The lumix had as good or better image quality compared to the Nikon, but not the zoom reach (600 vs 1000 mm equivalent). So, after taking the same pictures with them all, comparing the pixel detail, noise, overall image quality, and ultimate "usability" I decided the Nikon P510 was the best long telephoto producer at that time.  The ability to shoot still subjects, hand holding the camera, when it was fully zoomed to the 1000 mm end, at exposures as long as 1/8 second and get consistently crisp images played a major role in this decision(Yes, I Am Serious).DP Review did a good review of this camera, I am only giving my opinion from six months of daily use.The GOOD:*  An excellent lens (especially considering the zoom range)*  Exceptional optical image stabilization (Nikon calls it vibration reduction)*  Very good color reproduction, and white balance*  Good flash exposure*  Very good articulated rear screen*  Good overall image qualityThe Not so Good:*  Menu is not very intuitive.  Things that should be easy to adjust are difficult to find.*  No focus lock, No exposure lock. Holding the shutter button does lock them until the shutter releases, after the  shot, exposure and focus reset even if you continue to hold the button half depressed.*  A significant time delay in the "live view" image you see in the EVF, or on rear screen compared to real time. This delay is probably less than 1/2 second, but is significant enough that you will loose many action shots.*  Zoom lens takes about 3 seconds to extend from full wide to full telephoto, then the auto focus may take another 2 - 3 seconds, depending on the illumination and contrast of the subject.  The auto focus is generally very accurate, once obtained, which can be difficult at long zoom (I frequently have to initiate a refocus to get the subject focused in, rather than the foreground or background).*  The video quality is not good at all.  The P510 may be able to shoot decent video if you use manual focus, but the few times I have taken video, the auto focus is way too active, even in good lighting/contrast situations.  If you want a camera for video, I highly recommend you look at a different one (both the Lumix and FujiFilms I tested before buying this one, had much better video performance).*  Very low light or night photography is generally best left to other cameras.  However, with sufficient illumination, such as a city that is well lighted, the results can be very good.*  Pretty bad chromatic aberration in high contrast areas (especially at wider angle zoom).*  Extremely prone to highlight clipping. I have to shoot about a stop faster than metered most of the time to avoid this clipping, and this increases noise in the shadows (and no doubt causes some loss of shadow detail).*  Function button is difficult to find without looking, as it sits just behind the shutter release and is even with the surface from which it should emerge (I put a droplet of clear epoxy on it).*  With a zoom this long, auto focus can be very difficult (focusing on a bird in a tree for example). Nikon and other superzoom makers should offer a way for the user to direct auto focus as it gets close to focusing on the intended subject, rather than having to refocus over and over until the camera eventually finds focus, AND they certainly should make it easy to maintain that focal point until the user decides to refocus.*  Battery life isn't too bad. I get between 100 and 150 shots on a charge. My shooting isn't typical, I would think the average user would get over 200 shots per charge. Others have criticized the lack of an external charger, however, I think that for the casual user, USB charging through the camera might be sufficient. If I were going on vacation, or serious about capturing images of an event, I would want at least one spare battery. I bought 4 spare batteries and a charger on eBay for about $15

Reviews.Title: A Great In Between P&S; Camera
Reviews.Author: William Bash "Someone Who Still Cares"
Reviews.Content: The Nikon P510 is Nikon's 2012 follow on product to their well received "P" Series family of products.  You have, or can, read about all the features, details, and specifications published about this particular Model product elsewhere.  So rather than bore the reader herein with all the techno, spec jargon, here are a few examples of what I have experienced with this product.  The product "does" provide excellent color rendering for both Still Shots, and Movie/Video Recording.  It captures images in an impressive manner in both bright, and low light (example: In the woods, sun setting with fading light, but you do get nice golden colors, darker shadows at that time of the day, etc.) this camera duplicates that which our human eyes see in excellent detail.  This product is easy to use: Its Menu systems for (Still, Movie recording, and Playback menus) are essentially straight forward so that the beginner, or experienced photographer can utilize and set Modes, Dials, and control Buttons, in a logical manner.  Of course its high Zooming capability works very well out to, and past, its advertised 42x "Optical" Zooming spec.  There is another 42x power "Digital" internal camera zooming compounding the Optical Zooming, plus an "internal" camera feature to nearly double the Optical & Digital magnification to create something on the order of 160x Power. Of course, your photos become more grainy as magnification is increased, and Sharpness also declines with more magnification - but that is just a matter of fact for "all" cameras and lenses, and our own human eyes as well.  This model product is reasonably fast in focus, shutter, and capture timing.  Its start up from the off position is a little slower than some other products, but not an issue.  Color rendering even at full telephoto is impressive, and focusing is good at telephoto setting considering its Lens to Camera Sensor internal auto-focal length calibrating.  Focusing of course is faster at Wide, or less Focal lengths, say up to 20-25 power Zoom.  42x is still good, just a little slower.One negative that others have noted also - when Movie recording, and especially at longer zooming - the Lens system physically/mechanically moves around within the Camera's barrel that holds the Lens assembly.  This results in a small quick jumping of the recorded image(s) each time you zoom in, or out, while recording, and then prominently seen during Playback of a recorded Movie.  Nikon needs to tighten up the physical/mechanical dimensions fitting between the Lens and Camera Barrel.  Not a real big issue, but non-the-less needs improved - are you reading noting this NIKON?Another small item, Battery Charging can only be done in-Camera via the wall adapter and USB cable provided.  It would be nice if Nikon would/could provide a battery charging wall adapter that charges the battery outside of the camera so that you do not have to tie up the camera itself while charging a battery(s).  Optional external battery wall chargers can be purchased, along with extra batteries (as a foot-note only) Amazon seller "Blue Nook" has excellent products along these lines.Bottom Lines: This Nikon product offers nice capabilities for Auto, Semi-Auto, and Manual setting modes and usage, is an excellent value for its price point, produces excellent color rendering, is light weight, fits the hand very well, nice checkered urathane rubber front and side covering handgrip, comes with a CD Disc for loading your complete Users Manual and Software usage Manual (Nikon VX2) which certain other manufacturers have recently ceased providing, and has great battery run time.  It is in direct competition with Sony's DSC-HX200V higher end Point & Shoot camera product (which in my own opinion is just slightly better that this Nikon), but this Nikon is also top-shelf, and does what it is supposed to do for you.  I own both of these products.I'm not Mr. expert, only a Photography enthusiast who primarily photographs Landscapes and Wildlife utilizing DSLR's, SLT products, and higher end Point & Shoot camera products.  This Nikon "does" hit the mark.  You will not be disappointed should you decide to purchase this product.  Perhaps this review will help others.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix P510
Reviews.Author: Admin
Reviews.Content: I'm no expert photographer or anywhere near that but here are a few pros and cons that I have found with the camera since I have bought one. I'm a point and shoot type of guy and like the simplicity of these cameras. I also like a camera I can put in my pocket since I hate carrying stuff, but I have beenfighting the macro feature on my small point and shoot cameras and just got tired of that. I shoot small items like pcb's for example and wanted something a little better. I decided to check out this camera a while back and just loved that I could get so close to items I wanted to photograph andthe lens just focused right then and there. This is my very first Nikon, and camera with all of these settings. I knew it was a little bigger but decided on this one for the micro setting and not the large zoom it comes with. Although that's a nice bonus. I think a dslr would probably give youeven better closeups but I just didn't want that extra stuff and weight myself. I'm still working on getting a bit more detail on my macros, but this could also be me and not the camera itself. It's definitely better than my two point and shoot cameras I've had and I only use them for web pictures somy need for high resolution hasn't been necessary. With that said, nothing is perfect but I'm only pointing out the little things that I have noticed and those that do bug me.Pros:-Macros and Long zoom without a doubt-Size because it is smaller than a dslr-New 64GB sdxc class 10 seems to work out of the box. These use the exFAT format. I just went ahead and formatted the card and it's still in exFAT. I want to see if it makes a difference on anything now that it's formatted in the camera.-The included editing program seems basic, but it has all the basic features I want in a program. It's not perfect but it's free. It did take me a bit to find the basic crop and where things were. I like the feature to upload and delete all the files from the sd card. This works great as I always have an empty camera ready to go. Since I'm always on the computer I also just leave it plugged in which also charges the battery, so I haven't yet ran into a problem with it not lasting. I took about 100 pictures and that's a lot for me, so we'll see once I start using the other settings and taking more shots. The included wall charger uses the same cable to charge the camera. I had to plug my old camera just the same way so I'm used to that but my old one didn't get charged by the usb, this one does.-I like the green light ring around the power button when you turn it on and it blinks when on standby mode. It's a nice touch.-The camera seems to start relatively fast.-I got a better deal elsewhere than amazon. I got free shipping, no tax and a coupon that took a few more bucks of the total. Just couldn't beat it. At the current prices I say look at a dslr since they are just a bit more. I'm a point and shoot person and I just didn't want to spend all this on a camera. If not, just go down and get a pocket camera as this will be less and fit in your pocket if your needs are similar. If you find a deal, then by all means, otherwise I would not have bought it even though it suits my purpose.Cons:-I like to use things as they are designed, so the first thing I noticed while carrying it around is that the neck strap is a bit short. I feel like I'm getting chocked by the camera when it's around my neck because there's not enough slack to move it around. I have adjusted the strap to give me the furthest length but it's still a bit short. It's just uncomfortable for me and I'm not a tall guy either. I know I can buy one, but why should I have to when you spend this much on the camera. The strap is thin at the camera holders so it doesn't feel too strong if you were too pull hard on it accidentally. It works, but just feels that way to me.-For the price you pay, Nikon doesn't even include a cleaning cloth! The first thing I did by accident was to put my finger on the lens while handling it. All I had at the time was my cotton shirt and guess what...it's what worked on my old point and shoots so the shirt had to do if I wanted to start shooting without my thumb smudge on the lens.-Cameras used to come with a simple leather cover that you just snapped out and let it hang. Now the camera doesn't even come with anything and if you can find them for some cameras they cost and arm and a leg. I know there are many bags and things to choose from, but it would be nice if I could get something just for the one I bought that actually fits and it's not bulky. I like keeping things to a minimum so carrying extra stuff is not what I'm going to do.-Moving from picture to picture can be a tad slow when viewing for some reason. At least at times is feels like it. Again, I'm using the latest type of sdxc and class 10 card.-Starting and stopping video also seems to take it's time. I just hope they can speed this up a bit. I can see that firmwares can be updated through the editing program and see other cameras there, so I hope a firmware will fix this.-The night shots without the flash take a while to save. You get the hour glass for a bit. I'm not sure why, but man that's annoying. Although the pictures at night have been good so far on auto, you just have to wait for it to save. I tried the video briefly and it was reasonably good too, surprisingly.-For some reason the delete image options seems backwards to me. I feel that if the "yes" was on the bottom and the "no" the top, it would be more intuitive to use as your thumb is already on the buttons and the bottom is selected and hitting down just makes sense or ok if they were flipped, but instead you have to push the thumb up which just doesn't feel natural. All other settings seems fine.-One feature I totally forgot about and wished this camera had would be the option to add an external microphone to allow me to walk back a bit from the camera and talk without a problem. The included mics are good so far, so I guess we are stuck with the built in mics.-Extended warranty. You have 10 days to submit your form. It took 7 days for me to get the camera and then UPS left it at the wrong door step on a friday. I had been waiting for it so I picked it up as soon as it got here but had to wait until saturday to get the card out and the nearest post office was closed. I had to find another one eventually. So basically they need to leave this open or really allow more time as there are things that we just can't control. If you don't send it within the time frame, then it's too bad from what I read elsewhere. I'm not sure but I sure hope they do fix this.-Proprietary usb connection. Why? It's almost 2013 and they can't use a standard usb cable?-No printed manual. It only comes in a cd. You only get a printed quick quide. I prefer a printed manual I can take with me as I can't remember all the different settings and that would have been very helpful. At least to me.I'll be updating this as time goes on.Update notes:I've been testing the night landscape mode. The pictures are clear but the colors are not as vivid as the auto mode. I know that I should use some other setting, but this is just using the setting by itself. They look great on the LCD, but the pictures came out almost washed out I guess you call it. The weather isn't that great either, but they are not like the auto where you can really see red as red and not sort of red. I took some other night shots with the auto and the colors really show much better. Just to give you the comparison between the two modes.Video and zoom, yeah don't zoom in and out because it's hard to focus if you do. Usually you shouldn't be zooming, but thought I add this for those that think you can. It's nice that you can take hd videos with it. Too bad it's slow at starting and stopping at the moment. I just formatted my card in the camera so we'll see if that helps. I was using it right out of the carton but both use the exFAT so I don't think that will make any difference.I forgot to mention that I was testing the video and for some reason the camera just shutdown on me. It took a little while for it to turn on again. The battery was full, or at least the icon still said it was full. I noticed the video I took is a bit choppy. I really don't know what happened, but again I'm hoping they fix these minor things in the firmware because if they can't that will really suck.Update January 9, 2012I finally went out and did some more testing with the new sd card. I found out that the choppy video was not due to my sd cards. Yesterday I tested the 16gb sd polaroid class 10 that I have and I noticed that choppy videos, again. I also found out that the camera only does this on the 1080p settings not the lower settings. So it is the camera and not either of my sd cards. As I mentioned before the new card is a 64gig sdxc card.Update January 10, 2013I just read that Fujifilm has announced two similar long lense cameras. Their models are Finepix Hs50exr and Finepix SL1000 in case anyone else is interested in something similar.Update January 12, 2013I finally had a chance to test the battery and sure enough, at around 200 pictures including a few videos, the battery was done. I had fully charged it before this event. Very disappointing, not to mention it was only 10:30pm at the party when things were just starting to pick up. There was also no place to plug in to charge anything, so I was done once this happened. A message saying battery depleted came on the screen. The camera did not turn off by itself like I read some say, but I could not do anything else other than turn it off and once this was done, it would not turn back on no matter what, which makes sense if the battery is depleted. Either way I had to update on this. I just never owned a camera that quit on me like this.

Reviews.Title: Great Zoom
Reviews.Author: H
Reviews.Content: Let me first say that I am not a talented photographer. I just wanted a reasonably priced camera that would allow me to photograph my child from a distance during sporting events, at the beach, etc. This camera works great for that. The photos seem very clear and sharp. I am very satisfied with their quality. The video works well enough that I do not carry a separate video camera any longer.

Reviews.Title: Nice little camera -- not perfect, but not bad
Reviews.Author: Mary Barnett
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as an adjunct to my Nikon SLR.  I take a lot of wildlife photographs, and am used to carrying a 50-500mm zoom lens with me.  Unfortunately, shoulder problems dictate that I carry a lighter camera with me when I can.  The Coolpix P510 is both compact and lightweight.  It's not too difficult to use or learn.The P510 has lots of automatic shooting presets.  The 16 megapixels is ample; the 42x optical zoom is a nice feature, and it takes pretty good pictures right out of the box.  It's got manual shooting modes, too.  You can use autofocus or you can manually focus the camera if you wish.  You can use the digital viewfinder or the LCD screen.  It takes pretty good movies, too, with stereo sound.I really like it for macro photography because I can get really close (less than an inch) to my subject with it; I've gotten some really good macros with it.  It's okay on zoomed shots, though there does tend to be a bit of noise at higher zoom levels.  I did not find it easy to focus (I used both manual or automatic modes for this)on moving objects such as a bird in flight with the digital viewfinder.  Maybe that's just me, but I'm more used to looking through my lens, without any electronic rendering on a viewfinder screen.  As for shots taken at the widest angle, the colors are vibrant and lifelike.Overall, it's a nice little camera to have, and I will be carrying it with me any time I'm having problems carrying the heavier camera.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera!
Reviews.Author: Cricket
Reviews.Content: I haven't had this camera very long-but so far I'm really enjoying it. I love the 42x zoom-makes it so much easier to get the great pix of animals-because you're far enough away-they don't realize their picture is being taken-also I live close to the mountains-and that zoom allows some beautiful pix. I got the red-love the color. The size is pretty good too-it's not as compact as a point and shoot-but not big and bulky like some SLR cameras I've looked at. It's easy to use right out of the box (once the battery gets charged)-just set it to auto and shoot away. But I'm glad there are a lot of settings to allow professional looking photos to be taken by an amateur like myself. I also like that it works with an Eye-fi card (which I purchased separately).The reasons I didn't give it 5 stars-are because it seems to use a lot of battery power (but I just keep a second one charged). Also when at full zoom-it takes awhile to focus and you have to hold very still when pushing the shutter (a tripod would be a good thing to use at those times). But all in all-I would definitely recommend this camera to others.

Reviews.Title: Long Lens alone worth the price
Reviews.Author: brianlmft
Reviews.Content: Image is sharp even at maximum zoom of 1000mm equivalent. It's also a 24 mm wide angle lens as well. That's two lenses you don't have to buy right there. Look up what a lens of this size would cost by itself, more than twice the price of this camera alone! Took a shot of the full moon on a clear night and the individual craters could be easily viewed in great detail. Not great in dim light for long magnification. But for nature photography, you can't beat it. Lots of complaints about focusing in the reviews. Here is my solution - there are at least 4 focus modes you can set. The single AF mode, where you push the shutter down halfway to get it to focus, works best. It allows you to refocus, rezoom and refocus quickly until you get it right. Does not take that long to do, 10 seconds tops. The full-time FT auto focus overworks itself, takes too long, and is not as precise. The single AF mode gives you the most control. Also,for exposure, I generally just set it on auto and forget it. The camera is smarter than I am, and selects everything you need. And quickly enough for you to still get the shot before the critter moves. This camera is a point and shoot if you want it to be. All the way to fully manual if you prefer, even the focus can be manually set.Don't look to this camera to do it all, you will be disappointed. It is not a DSLR. I shot a pix of a deer at 50 yds., and I could still see every hair on the hide as clearly as if it had been right in front of me. Just really sharp. Software is very easy to use and download to your computer. Don't buy that long lens you have been looking at, buy this camera instead. I am glad I did!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: MnMom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are going to South America for our "trip of a lifetime".  I had a small point and shoot Sony camera and wanted something a little more sophisticated for the trip.  I tried out a few different cameras and found this to be the best by far.  The camera is incredibly light weight, the zoom is fabulous and the picture quality is perfect.  I've been using it for a month and can't find anything that I don't like about it.  I can't to capture our vacation with this.

Reviews.Title: Incredibly capable but easy to use
Reviews.Author: Pete
Reviews.Content: Remember those cheesy magazine ads: "the camera that lets you take pictures like a pro!"  Well this is the closest thing I've seen to making that a reality.  The zoom is the equivalent of a big 100mm zoom on the old SLRs but unlike the old SLRs, the built in anti-shake software means you can shoot it hand held at max optical zoom.  The lens is very efficient too, so you can get fast shutter speeds in low light.  Even in pure point and shoot mode, all kinds of pictures are easy and look amazing, and there are plenty of features for more advanced photographers too.  About the only complaint I've had is that the menu can take a lot of clicks for some simple things (for example I'd like to get timer in one button push, not 3).  The camera's even compact enough that it fits in the case of my old point and shoot.  Just an outstanding camera all around.

Reviews.Title: SIMPLY AMAZING!
Reviews.Author: Dan
Reviews.Content: disregard the bad reviews this badboy is simply amazing the zoom is out of this world ...took a license plate of a car from my 17th floor window miles away as clear as daylight .. focus is fine ..as long as you know what you are doing of course..Chose this one instead of the SX40 and couldn't be happier ..every private eye's dream :)

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: Shawn
Reviews.Content: Bought the Nikon P510 after having my eye on the P500 for a while. I love this camera ! ! ! The selling point for me was the 42X zoom, 16MP and the HD recordings.This was an upgrade from my Nikon S550.The quality of the pictures and video are great. there is a bit of background noise on most of the videos that I have recorded though, but it doesn't drown out the audio - maybe a setting taht I have missed.On maximum settings the pictures are quite large and would require some storage space if the camera is used regularly.The camera itself feels sturdy and solid unlike some online reviews that said the construction was weak.While the supplied OEM Nikon battery lasts long after is has been depleted and fully charged a few times but buy an extended battery if you get clicker-happy.The flash is terribly bright and has a far reach.Use of the digital view finder is a must if you want to maximize battery lifeThe zoom is electronic and is a bit slow.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Camera!
Reviews.Author: Kim E. Fowler "Kim E. Fowler"
Reviews.Content: The price is fantastic in and of itself!  The things you can do with this is limitless!  I havent used half the features yet and it continues to amaze me!  The digital zoom is perfect!  Best camera I have ever owned and that includes a digital SLR!!!

Reviews.Title: Great all around camera
Reviews.Author: L. F. Buehler
Reviews.Content: This was voted one of the best travel cameras and I couldn't agree more. Easy to use. Great pictures. Very versatile. All lot of camera in a compact size. I use this and leave my SLR and lenses at home. It is the camera I grab when I travel and leave the others at home.

Reviews.Title: Nice
Reviews.Author: rblaw
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera. Produces high quality photos. If it had an optical rather than electronic viewfinder, I would consider it a replacement for an SLR.

Reviews.Title: love this camera!!!!
Reviews.Author: qallab, maen
Reviews.Content: The wide angel is wide, the zoom is amazing and all in one lens!! It is easy to use and takes great pictures.It fits my needs perfectly and is easy to use.speedy delivery.

Reviews.Title: best zoom point and shoot camera
Reviews.Author: aggywaggy
Reviews.Content: Love this camera!  Fast response zoom.  A bit sensitive and shaky when taking live shots during the day, but clarity is awesome.A bit of noise at 300 mm.

Reviews.Title: Nikon P510
Reviews.Author: SuzyQ
Reviews.Content: All that and a bag of chips? You betcha! The amount of on camera editing and effects is mind boggling yet the ease of use was really surprising. I bought this camera for its ability to do selective color (& I'm thrilled with that) but I must say some of the other effects are awesome! The manual setting is so easy! I have already taken some amazing moon shots and I have yet to watch the video or read the manual. I can't wait to learn more about this camera. The zoom is great. Obviously at max zoom you benefit from using a tripod by it does pretty darn good even if you just steady yourself on a pole. I highly recommend this camera! I already have a few friends who are going to get one. And if you do get one, be sure to get the red one because it's super pretty! (That's my girl comment :)

Reviews.Title: Nikon 510
Reviews.Author: Donald R. Treichler "Don Treichler"
Reviews.Content: Amazing camera. The glass alone is reason to purchase. As always, Amazon was prompt with delivery. Long distance video focus seemed a problem until switching focusing methods. All in all, a very capable camera that takes excellent pictures.

Reviews.Title: Best Mother's Day present ever!!
Reviews.Author: Accounting Goddess
Reviews.Content: I love it! It zooms in close enough with the optical zoom that I can sit in the deer blind and take such clear pictures of the deer that you can see their eyelashes! It's an amazing camera and exactly what I was looking for!

Reviews.Title: Brilliant
Reviews.Author: Sharon M. Coleman
Reviews.Content: I love this camera, i have the one model before, the P500, but wanted to upgrade to a larger zoom & GPS. The GPS is a great addition. It also has some extra features > "effects", you can choose many different effects, i particularly like the "painting" effect, has a nice "nostalgic sepia" also, whatever you decide to use, they all come out great! The shots taken come out really clear, even good at full zoom, but must hold steady or you can use a tripod. I have taken photos of the moon, amazing. If you are looking for a good camera, then get this one, it`s amazing & you will love it. It`s good to go online & get the full manual, so you can get all the information & understand the features etc, as the small manual which comes with it is not adequate enough.

Reviews.Title: Good for this type of camera
Reviews.Author: A. Gray
Reviews.Content: This camera is a good camera, if you accept the inherent limitations of small sensor superzoom bridge cameras.Cons:- Bulky- Small sensor- No RAW files- Slow lensPros- Amazing zoom range- Much cheaper than corresponding DSLR or ICL camera- Good ergonomics- Great screen- ViewfinderThis lens is not for someone looking for great image quality, you just aren't going to get that with a sensor this size. It isn't for someone mainly shooting indoors without flash. It isn't for someone who wants a compact camera to carry around all the time.Who it is for is someone who loves telephoto photography and doesn't want to invest thousands of dollars for a DSLR. The zoom is simply amazing, and the image quality is good enough for wildlife and sports shooting. If you're looking for something to take on nature walks, birding, or to your children's games, this is perfect. If you don't shoot a lot of telephoto and need an all around camera that works great indoors with no flash, look for a compact camera with a larger sensor (1/1.7" or larger) and a fast lens (f/2 on the wide end).

Reviews.Title: EXCELLENT CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Kentana
Reviews.Content: We have another Nikon, which is also an excellent camera, but wanted a point and shoot.  A friend met a National Geographic Photographer in Africa who was using this camera and had high praise for it.Following a fair amount of comparison shopping and reasearch, we purchased this camera and could not be more pleased.The P510 has quite a number of features that will handle whatever any photographer may need.  The 16 mp and 42x zoom are great.Photographs taken with the camera are some of the best quality I have seen.  The clarity and color are unmatched.I hardily recommend this camera for both the novice and more experienced photographer.

Reviews.Title: Really like this camera!
Reviews.Author: DWieland
Reviews.Content: I have a Nikon D300 that I truly enjoy using, but I wanted a lighter weight camera to keep in my handbag for those moments when you see a scene you want to shoot.  I have taken a lot of different photos with this camera and the photos are crisp and clear.  The color is awesome and I could not be happier with this camera!  I have tried so many different point and shoot cameras and would highly recommend this one for anyone.  The zoom is incredible.  I usually use my D300 for shooting my son's baseball games, but today spent some time using the P510 and was amazed at the shots even using the zoom to its full extent.  If zooming all the way out you do need a steady arm, but it worked really well!  The built in effects and scenes are great as well.  So far, no complaints with the camera.  It is light weight, full of great features and so light weight to carry around with you all the time.I do find it annoying that the price on Amazon keeps changing so if ordering you might want to monitor the price during different times of the day.  You could save up to $50.

Reviews.Title: Love, love, love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Sarah Vanderwende
Reviews.Content: First off... the zoom on this thing... is AMAZING! I had good distance away seats at a concert and I could zoom in on the drummer clear as day on auto. I was amazed. I've also shot another concert from right up front and this thing did amazing on auto. It took me a lil while to get use to waiting for it to focus all the way but that's all in learning how the camera works. I've also used this for social events with friends and it does well there too. I honestly have nothing bad to say about this camera, I love it. Best money I've spent in a while. And I was very hesitant about spending $400 on a camera. I really haven't dug too deep into the like set it yourself settings cause I don't really know what to use when yet but all of the menus are very easy to navigate. This has a really cool like color sense mode that you can set to sense just one color and the rest is in black and white. I think it's a nifty add on. I'd recommend this camera to anyone! It's well worth the money if you're looking to invest this much in a camera.

Reviews.Title: I LOVE THIS CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Joan Winslow
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera little over a year and cannot get over how much I still love it.  The pictures have such great quality and the zoom is phenomenal!  I broke once but Nikon fixed it since it was covered under warranty. The thing I like about this camera is I can carry it in my purse.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Pictures
Reviews.Author: Gina M. Keenan-Heepke "HSH CLD"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my husband.  We had a smaller coolpix and were very happy with it.  This camera has a huge memory card.  My husband takes tons of pictures and dumps anything that he doesn't like.  The camera has the normal viewing screen on the back but it also has a viewfinder which is great on sunny days.  The zoom is amazing and easy to use.  We have taken pictures of things nearly a 1/2 mile away that look like the subject is in our front yard.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Camera and Very Easey to use!
Reviews.Author: Debra John
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera from AMAZON a few days ago and already I am amazed at what it can do.  Tonight I took a picture of the moon (without a tripod) using the night landscape mode. I am amazed at the details in the photo.  This afternoon I took my camera to the beach and used the full zoom (42x) to take photos of birds unlike anything I have taken befoe. When you don't have to sneak up on them, the photo ops are endless. Once I read the manual and play with it some more, I will update my review.Just learned how to change the image quality to fine. Took another picture of the moon and now I can see craters in the photo. Could not find a place to upload a photo in a review but you can see it on my web site if you want to check it out.  I added it to my Nature Photos Gallery at [...]

Reviews.Title: Nikon CoolPix P510
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: // To view this video download Flash Player (version 9.0.115 or higher)'); } } catch(err) { fp_resizePlayerSpace('cv_mo1T0M0TKKXNN5R', 0, 0); } return false; } function _cv_mo1T0M0TKKXNN5RloadSwf(movieID, playerVersion) { var swfLocation = "http://g-ecx.images-amazon.com/images/G/01/am3/20120510035744301/AMPlayer._V148501545_.swf"; } cv_mo1T0M0TKKXNN5Rpreplay.onmouseout = function() { cv_mo1T0M0TKKXNN5Rpreplay.src = "http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/71EeG5glLSS._SX320_PHcustomer-video-vignette_PIvideo-reviews-bottom,BottomLeft,0,43_OU01_PIcustomer-video-play,BottomLeft,130,-12_CR0,0,0,0_.png"; logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_mo1T0M0TKKXNN5RcurrentClick) { return cv_mo1T0M0TKKXNN5RcurrentClick(); } } } Length:: 1:00 Mins I purcased this camera after dropping my Nikon L-1 at a jobsite which resulted in the battery compartment always popping open unexpectedly. The L1 was a great point and shoot for work but I wanted something more but something I could easily carry around for work. A bridge camera seemed to fit the bill since I also wanted to play around with video as well. The zoom on this simply blew me away. As for video, I never expected this to do what it does. After all, if you want to shoot video you get a video recorder right? No need. The video I have included is my very first serious try at shooting HD video, not including the "walk around the yard stuff" I shot when I first got it. This was shot over Thanksgiving on Hilton Head Island from about 50 yards away. As it turns out I had a very cooperative subject. The heron didn't show up until close to dark but immediatedly caught a mullet, which you can see flipping about even as being swallowed. This camera produces professional grade material, but compose your own shots. I prefer to set the aperature and let the camera do the rest but the manual mode lets you do it all. There is a learning curve with this camera as it does so much, but I guess that's true of most new cameras. I love the red case, too.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Tamara
Reviews.Content: I love this camera! This is the first camera I've had that's more than just a point and shoot and its great. So far I have no complaints about it....although I'm still learning about all of the features!

Reviews.Title: Extreme value
Reviews.Author: A. Stanfield
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a compact super-zoom camera look no further. Everything is above expectations, speed, friendlyness, focusing speed, etc. With all the features included (I will not re-list them here) it's a no-brainer, however what strikes me most is the quality pictures you can take on dimm light and no flash. That's a cool feature specially when the subjects are beyond the builtin flash's range.I was evaluating the new Nikon 1 but, after careful thought, I decided against it in favor of the P510 due to more versatility, zoom, features, gps and less price.It's a safe buy for anyone looking for a feature packed camera and not willing to spend/carry a pro SLR

Reviews.Title: About the battery life
Reviews.Author: FoodBlogger47
Reviews.Content: I agree with most reviews on all things but the battery life. I keep the camera linked to my computer and turned off unless I'm uploading photos or using the camera. Doing this recharges the battery.For my three previous cameras, I had to have extra batteries and battery chargers, which I had to use often. I had to always have a spare battery in my case. After reading the reviews here, I thought I'd have to do that with this camera, but I decided to watch and wait. I've had this camera for more than a year, and I've never had the battery fail me.This past weekend, I was a little worried. We traveled two days through peak color in WV and VA and spent time with the grandkids. I took a LOT of photos, and I had no way to recharge the battery. The battery was still working beautifully to the end.

Reviews.Title: Very good camera.
Reviews.Author: SMH "SMH"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for photos of North Montana, Glacier Park, and Yellowstone. I am pleased overall with the camera. I took 1300 photos when all was said and done.Positives:* Clarity and detail of photos were beyond my expectations.* Landscape Mode is MOST EXCELLENT. Better than any other camera I have owned.* The Zoom (to include the digital) is just as great as described.* The stability feature is fantastic. Of the 1300 photos, only perhaps a dozen carried a blur from my shaky hands. The rest were stabilized, even at max zoom.* Panorama worked well in assist mode. Pleased.* Low light mode? AWESOME. I took a couple of photos of the moon with Jupiter alongside that were simply amazing. The same with landscapes at dusk with very little light left. Low light mode was amazing.Negatives:* Auto-shoot mode was weak and I could not count on it to provide a quality photo. More of these were blurred than should have been..especially accounting for the 'wait' for focus.* Temperature effected the camera (I am not an expert or a pro photographer, so I don't know exactly what to expect...maybe this is normal): Outside temperatures of 36f down to 32f effected the focus/zoom horribly. The camera would not focus auto or manual. Only after zooming in and out perhaps two dozen times did the camera 'warm up' and begin to act normally. This was a problem on an all day trek where, although clear skies, the temperature stayed within the above-mentioned ranges. (When the temperature was 40f or above...no issues whatsoever.)I would have loved to give 5-stars, but my experience with Auto-Mode and the very bad time with the lower temperature situation pulled me down to a 4.That said, I WOULD RECOMMEND this all day long to the outdoor casual or amateur photographer (indoors as well). I believe 100% that it was worth the cost.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Camera!
Reviews.Author: AER
Reviews.Content: I have been a Nikon fan in the past, previously buying 2 Coolpix Cameras (3100 and 4100). The quality and durability of Nikons are great, so when I decided to get a more powerful camera, Nikon was the way to go! I've had the camera for a few weeks now, and I love it! There are so many great aspects of this camera that I haven't had in the past with other brands!Pros:-The camera charges and turns on extremely quickly. I was amazed by how quickly it charged the first day! Since purchasing the camera, I've only had to charge it once! The battery life is great- I don't use my camera on a daily basis, so perhaps it would take more charges if you did, but for recreational use, it has a great battery life!-This camera is much lighter than I expected! It looks large, but it doesn't feel heavy when you've got it around your neck!-The GPS feature is really cool! It's nice to be able to remember where exactly I took a picture if it's of a landscape/flower, etc.-The grip on the camera is great! You don't feel your fingers slide, and you can really hold on to the camera well!-The pop out screen is awesome! You can move the screen to see the photo you're taking better, especially if you're holding the camera at odd angles!-Great quality pictures that are easy to take- I'm no camera genius, but even my mother who can barely use a camera can take great pictures with this camera! It's got so many settings- you can take a standard picture without adjusting ISO and it still looks just as great!-So many settings- There are so many great settings on this camera! The selective color feature is great, and I love the panorama shots! There are also great lighting features so no matter the light in the background, the photo looks great!-The zoom is incredible! From 50 feet away I can take a perfect photo of a flower that looks like I was standing next to it! On most cameras I've owned the farther zoom means poorer quality photos, but this camera is perfect for taking long range pictures and having them look flawless!-The video quality is great! I went to a Flamenco show and took video, and the picture quality and sound quality was amazing!Cons:The only major con I've noticed so far is that it can take a second to refocus after zooming out a large distance. It's not bad, but if you wanted to  take a picture of something that would be gone after a few seconds, you have to be really prepared to take your photo!This camera is definitely worth the price tag! It's been a great investment so far!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera.
Reviews.Author: focus 1
Reviews.Content: I recieved my nikon p510 two days ago and so far it has surpassed my expectations. I was reading reviews about this product for the last three months before I decided to get it. It produces amazing photos. I just love this cam. I especially enjoy photographing my natural environment and I've had quite a few WOW!! moments in the last two days. Thanks nikon. No product is perfect but what this cam does makes it great. I know I'm going to enjoy shooting with it especially after i get used to all its features.

Reviews.Title: Nikon P510
Reviews.Author: S. Micahel "SueRexy"
Reviews.Content: Received the Nikon P510 in 2 days.  Have played with it for 2 weeks now and LOVE this camera... The pictures are crisp and clear.  I have taken some outstanding action photos of birds fully zoomed and handheld.  Also have used a monopod and gotten great results.  Love the color, it is classy.  The only con I have with this camera is you can't put a filter lens on it or a lens hood...  (I did however take a Koolie Cup Holder and cut the bottom off and slip it over the the lens and and that helps some with extremely bright sun shots.)  Looking forward to enjoying this camera and not always carrying my Canon DSLR all the time.

Reviews.Title: Initial Use Review
Reviews.Author: KateInHawaii "KateInHawaii"
Reviews.Content: I bought the P510, though looking to replace a P&S; ZS-1 Panasonic that I still love (but has a scratched lens). I like zoom, and this Nikon has it. P510 is light, small, has a good grip feel--I added a hand strap in lieu of the neck strap. I bought it with the recommended bag, which was a great purchase.There's a big bag of features on all new cameras and I find, for myself, most of the ones tried on the P510 are useful: auto scene, shutter, aperture and program settings I find myself using so far. Most of the time it focuses, but like another reviewer said, it can be maddening when it won't focus, especially at the long end. Maybe we're expecting too much.It's the battery life that's bothersome. It will just shut down w/o warning because the battery meter in the upper right of screen will indicate full battery life, but it 'taint so. I'm buying some Wasabi battery back-ups. Don't expect 200+ shots on a charge when you're moving that lens in/out and using the screen. I use EVF to try to spare the battery, though it's not the best.I'm still assessing shot quality. I'm not "thrilled", but since most of what I shoot goes on the web, I don't require razor sharp. I'm keeping my D90 when I'm seeking crisp.

Reviews.Title: A GREAT CAMERA!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera for all it's features, first of all the red color is so amazing, AND THE ZOOM I can't believe how close I can get to the people and things I'm taking pictures of, I had thought that my dream camera was one of those big SLR cameras but after getting this Nikon I gotta say I'm in love with it, the camera takes crisp clear pictures the zoom is so great I took it with me when I took my son to the zoo and even the animals that were high in a tree or hard to see I got pics of them that made it look like they were right in front of me. And some other reviews voiced concerns about the length of battery life but I've taken ALOT OF PICS on a single charge and at two different occasions (I had forgotten to charge the camera in between events). And the video feature is really good considering it's not "video camera", I have a small pocket sized Nikon point and shoot which is a great camera too but I've been using this one 100% of the time now because I'm just so amazed at the job it does!!!!!! It's totally worth the price, anybody looking at this camera and who is on the fence about buying it stop thinking and do it your gonna love it!!!!!!!! And go for the red it's BEAUTIFUL., if I could rate it better then 5 stars I would that's how impressed I am. A word of advice though invest in a really good sd card for it I was using one from my old camera but then purchased a Lexar 16GB with 400x speed and the camera works even better now.

Reviews.Title: EXCELLENT!
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: 1) Just got this camera and used it....a lot. 42X crystal clear zoom and EXCELLENT pictures, especially in "auto", "scene" and "macro" modes, for this price...are you kidding me!2) Please, by all means disregard the foolish reviews comparing this EXCELLENT camera to $3000+ cameras with $1000+ extra lenses that can take a clear picture of a fly's moving wings from a mile away. If you want the same picture results as the people sitting on the floor under the basketball hoop at a pro game, well be prepared to hand over $5000+!3) I also read complaints about the zoom being heard while video recording....are you kidding me....IT HAS A 42X ZOOM MOTOR....HELLO??.....anybody home upstairs?! Here is a clue for the clueless...."If you want a video camera....buy a video camera....dummy!"4) Also, more clueless people complain about the 42X zoom taking too long to focus (like 2 to 4 seconds)...are you kidding me! If you are in such a hurry....maybe you should find another hobby...like playing ping pong!5) Also, do yourself a favor a disregard the foolish reviews comparing functions of similar cameras that the human eye can't even detect....are you kidding me! I didn't know SUPERMAN was doing camera reviews!5) Do yourself a favor....buy this camera. You won't be sorry!6) LASTLY....did a mention disregarding the foolish reviews!....are you kidding me!

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix P510
Reviews.Author: Ganason Nadason
