Reviews.Content: This is a very good camera. The zoom lens is excellent. I use it frequently to photograph birds which are high up in the trees or at a distance. I have taken some beautiful shots with this camera. No need to purchase expensive, heavy and bulky telephoto lens!

Reviews.Title: The closest to what I want so far
Reviews.Author: Jennifer J Williams
Reviews.Content: I have been through 3 different cameras so far.  My first camera was a top of the line Canon and I just wasn't satisfied.  So I thought I needed a fancier camera and ended up buying a Sony nex-3 mirrorless camera but wanted a zoom to it.  So I bought the 200mm lens.  While it took great pictures, I hated manually having to focus and it didn't zoom as much as I wanted it to.  But the kicker was not having the lens on it I wanted when I needed it.  I realized that I am a point and shoot girl and went to researching.  I wanted good mega-pixels and zoom.  This camera caught my eye and I waited a bit before I purchased it.  I have now had this camera over a year and it's pretty close to the perfect camera for me.  I have been able to take pictures of the moon close up.  On zoomed pics you have to either use a tripod if you don't want to fight the natural shake that your hand will have.  But it can be done with the hand.  I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 because I would love a lcd screen that could flip to the front but it's a minor thing.  I guess in the end, you have to figure out what are the main things you want a camera to do and start there.  I wanted zoom, good pics and ease of use and that is what I got.

Reviews.Title: Great product for the money!
Reviews.Author: D. Sadowski
Reviews.Content: I looked around for a lot of different camera's in this price range...  This has the biggest zoom I could find without having to step up to a camera with interchangeable lenses.  There are lots of pros and cons to anything you buy like this (better megapixels but smaller zoom, better for action shots, or in lower light, etc...) but all around this is a nice camera for the money and I would recommend it to anyone.  Some people really pick all of these different model cameras apart on a pro level.  And I understand that for the professional.  It's a good thing to have in depth reviews for folks that understand what all those fine details mean.  I'm not a professional photographer...  But I'm not a beginner by any means.  I have taken some photography courses and have a decent understanding of the craft.  But I simply wanted something with some pro level features, a nice zoom and great quality (clear) pics for both my wife and I to use. (she has no knowledge of photography).  Honestly, this camera works great for both of us...Stand out features to me are some of the continuous shooting modes and wonderful battery life...  Comes with a rechargeable battery pack that lasts a long time!!  If I had to pick something I don't like about it, I'd honestly have to say that the screen doesn't swivel.  Not that I really care about that... (which is why i still gave a 5 star rating)...  It shows that the screen has a bracket that allows it to slide off the back...  However, In my opinion this feature is almost useless because once you slide it off, it doesn't rotate.  I don't see the point...  Might be good to tilt the screen down if it was on a high tripod I guess, but that would be it's only function...  A simple swivel bracket would have allowed you to see the framing when using the timer feature...  Like I said, no biggie!  Really REALLY nice Camera for the mulah!  And my wife LOVED the red color!

Reviews.Title: unreliable, broke in 9 months
Reviews.Author: K. Serebryany
Reviews.Content: Good:  - reasonable quality of pictures  - price  - GPSBad:  - hangs often (and there is no firmware update with the fix)  - GPS starts working only after you keep the camera on for 5+ minutes  - the battery indicator shows full battery for long time, then suddenly says that the battery is exhausted.  - after 9 months of not-very-heavy use the camera stopped charging the battery at alloverall, very unsatisfied

Reviews.Title: Wonderful camera, amazing zoom, lots of useful features
Reviews.Author: Steven "mkayk55"
Reviews.Content: this thing is da Bomb!  Imagine a tree, halfway up a mountain, and we have a picture of an eagle in that tree.  You can see his feathers, the pine needles and the pinecones on the tree!  Amazing quality images, the 42 Zoom impressed everyone we shared pictures with.  We did an 11-day cruise/escursion, and are so thankful we got this before we left! amazing photos.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, good size, good batt life, great zoom, great price.
Reviews.Author: Potatopirate
Reviews.Content: Great camera for the $$ for sure.  Some reviews say that the low light performance is not good, but it has done great for us at night outside, even without a tripod.  Inside it performs great as well.  The zoom is amazing and the image stabilization works well. The battery life has been great so far.  The only down side that we have found is extremely minor, and that is that it doesn't have an orientation sensor for rotating the images automaticly.  It does have a "orientation sensor" but that turns out to be a "compass"  that assits in taking 360 degree panaramas.

Reviews.Title: This camera is absolutely perfect
Reviews.Author: Miguel A. Palau Jaimes "Mike"
Reviews.Content: Everything is new, came inside a white box, all accessories were included. The camera goes beyond my expectations it has an incredible body, perfect grip (better than Canon) and the lens its superb. In general its a point and shooter with some advances features like manual settings but dont expect a dslr. Pictures are great, nice color and balance in general.

Reviews.Title: Best camera I've ever owned
Reviews.Author: Princess
Reviews.Content: This camera is amazing!  It has an incredible zoom lens, which is what I was looking for.  Even though it's a point and shoot camera, it takes professional-looking photos.  It has great settings for any condition.  I use the "food" and "beach" settings a lot.  It does great in low light too.  I hardly ever need to use the flash.

Reviews.Title: A great little camera!
Reviews.Author: Gordon
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera because I wanted a camera with a long zoom!  The P510 does not disappoint.  Even handheld the camera manages to eliminate motion blur at maximum 1000mm equivalent zoom.  The image quality is excellent if you are not a "pixel peeper".  There is always some noise in digital camera images and when you cram 16 megapixels into a tiny little image sensor the problem just gets worse.  But this camera manages noise very effectively and still maintains good image detail.Just two minor complaints:  There is no RAW image option and there is no provision to add filters to the lens.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Garry S.
Reviews.Content: We've used the Nikon CoolPix P510 for about a year now, and we don't have anything but praise.  It meets our needs perfectly as a highly versatile and technically sound camera.  The options for photography seem to be limitless with this camera.  A few highly prized features for us are...42X zoom, Sport Mode (5 rapid-fire frames in succession), nice big screen with the optional toggle to the small view finder eye piece, and tons of special photo options.

Reviews.Title: Far Beyond My Expecations!
Reviews.Author: Kelli R Claypool ""There is nothing stand...
Reviews.Content: I love being outside and watching nature. Living on a farm, the beauty in the trees the way they sway back and forth in the wind, the sweet lullaby of the birds, the deer frolicking in the fields absolutely brings me joy. And I wanted to capture all of these amazing moments. I've gone through numerous cameras and have been somewhat satisfied but also disappointed. That is until I purchased this camera.There are so many features on this camera that I still have to learn, but the zoom capabilities are amazing. Within the first few days of having the camera I was able to capture several pictures of an American eagle up close. The eagle was about 500 yards away and the zoom made it look like I was right next to it. The detail in the picture was amazing.With this camera I'm able to do many things that I haven't been able to do before. I love the sports setting. My son plays football and with my old camera often times I'll snap a picture just seconds before an outstanding play and then I have to wait for the camera to readjust before taking another shot. With the Nikon Coolpix on the sports setting, it takes several continuous shots allowing me to get the perfect picture every time.I'm able to capture birds in flight, rushing rapids in the streams around our farm. I was even able to capture the entire birth of a calf which was the most amazing thing ever.Like I said before, there are so many features that I have not even figured out, but it's so much fun to play with all of the settings. The picture quality is absolutely amazing and I'm so in love with this camera. Plus it's red...and gorgeous! Definitely a purchase that I'm 100% pleased with.

Reviews.Title: This camera is amazing.  Not perfect for EVERYTHING, but amazing.
Reviews.Author: Gregory Ernst
Reviews.Content: I needed a camera that gives me options, and this is it.  The zoom (of course) is incredible, and the onboard features like HDR are a nice touch.  I need a slightly wide-angle option, zoom option, and lots of SLR-type features, but also the ability to rely upon the Auto setting.  This camera has it!  My one complaint is that the auto focus isn't as responsive as I'd like, and the manual focus can be lacking as well.  You can't get EVERYTHING in one inexpensive camera, however, and I have taken hundreds of gorgeous photos for fun, and for my profession.  I took some pictures of the Moon with this, on full zoom (various settings) and you can see craters in rich detail.  A friend actually thought I took a picture off the NASA website, and claimed it as my own.  Enough said about the zoom!  Really solid in the hand, and built well as far as I can tell.

Reviews.Title: Another Dud from Nikon!
Reviews.Author: Colinda "L.S.W."
Reviews.Content: I've used Nikon cameras for decades but it looks like this is the end of the road. The autofocus does not work and I've returned the camera for service and it still doesn't work. I took it outside to shoot sample pictures and the camera died. I've tried recharging it but still no luck. If I am doing something wrong, shouldn't it be obvious on a point and shoot?My latest communication from Nikon support provided some suggestions that are a little confusing but would be worth trying if only the camera would power on.My previous Coolpix digital had a bad start too. I had to return it twice but finally they fixed it and it worked well for a couple of years. Then it started having problems on full zoom, and since it's old it doesn't seem worth having repaired.This camera has some desirable features but it's been very frustrating. While it was working, I got the manual focus to work in Sports mode and got some good photos, but changing the focus manually requires using a tiny on-screen indicator that's just a line with very few marks to guide you. It was fine as long as I needed to shoot at infinity but was a pain to use at other distances. A point and shoot should be easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Useful for African safaris, kids' birthdays and everything in between
Reviews.Author: Saleem Siddiqui
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera in July 2012 right before a trip to Africa. I was glad that I did. I used its simple features and surprisingly powerful 42x zoom to good effect on a Kenyan safari and a Ghanaian bird-watching trip. This is not a DSLR, doesn't cost as much as a DSLR, and I don't expect it to function exactly like a DSLR. However, in my adequate but unprofessional hands; it is a very good tool to capture fleeting moments.The one thing you want to ensure is that you have a spare battery if you're going on a full-day of shooting, especially if you'll be outdoors. The motor for zooming in/out and the digital display consume a lot of power and can drain a fully charged battery within a few hours of rapid shooting. I can personally vouch for the utter disappointment of having a dead camera in one's hands when an African lion is slowly ambling 10 feet away from one's off-road vehicle!A small quibble is about the inability to shoot quality pictures in relatively dark surroundings when the subjects are moving. The one time where this affected me adversely the most was when I went with some colleagues to a bowling alley in Seoul and I was unable to capture any meaningful shots. I read the instruction manual that came with the camera but I haven't read the Digital Field Guide (recommended by some friends). I'm willing to admit that a bit more investment of time and effort, I could master this.I recommend this camera highly for an enthusiast, not a professional, photographer.

Reviews.Title: OMG! Takes AWESOME pics!
Reviews.Author: weasel
Reviews.Content: Took this on our vacation to Alaska and got great pics and videos of Humpback whales, bald eagles, seals, sea lions, and the gorgeous scenery. Compared to my old Nikon D40, it was really convenient not having to swap out lenses all the time. Saved a TON of hiking with the 42x zoom. Found out the digital zoom only works with the switch on the lens, not the one on the shutter button - but trying to photograph anything at that distance is going to require a tripod or other stabilization equipment (like the railing of a cruise ship). Also doesn't take up as much space as my old D40 and two lenses.

Reviews.Title: Great "Bridge" camera
Reviews.Author: Michael W Noel
Reviews.Content: Great camera for the money.  More than a pocket sized point and shoot, not as much as a DSLR.  I really couldn't justify the expense of DSLR and multiple lens so I went with the P510. The P510 will give you great pics in Auto mode, but still gives you plenty control in priority and manual modes.  The 42x lens really helps with wildlife shots.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera for a Novice User
Reviews.Author: IndiansDJ
Reviews.Content: I spent many weeks trying to find a camera that would allow me to take good quality pictures, without being too complicated. I wanted something better than a Point and Shoot, but nothing quite as high end as a professional grade camera. I had a few similar cameras to this one picked out.  I liked the Nikon brand so much more than the others, I had it narrowed down to the P510 and the P520 (the newer version of this camera). There really wasn't that many features on the P520 that weren't on the P510 to justify spending another $150 bucks, which is why I went with the P510.Pros:- Rechargeable battery. Replacements/Extras are inexpensive, even for a name brand. I have been using the camera for a month and haven't had to recharge the battery yet.- Large viewing screen that extends out.  This allows you to take photos at different angles while still being able to see the screen.- Has a few built in effect features. Easy to learn, simple to use. Saves times from editing on the computer.- GPS feature.- Very quick to power on.- Zoom is incredible.Cons:- Auto focus does take a while in some cases to focus.- The screen doesn't rotate like the P520. This would be a useful feature for seeing the screen if you have it setup on a tripod with a timer.Overall, I am extremely pleased with this purchase. All I wanted was a camera that would give me high quality images with some extra features, but nothing too complicated to learn.  This camera has done all of that for me. I have been taking pictures since day one and they have all came out excellent. I am glad that I made this purchase!

Reviews.Title: Battery Life Indicator is useless
Reviews.Author: csymon
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera based on the reviews I read about the picture quality and user interface. I will agree with all the reviews on those points - I had this camera figured out within 5 mins of owning it (which is more than I can say for the Sony I previously used), and the picture quality is fantastic.Now for the part I didn't expect - the battery life indicator is completely useless. It will show that I have a full battery even after 200 shots, and then all of the sudden, BOOM - you get the "Battery exhausted" screen and the camera turns off. I thought maybe I just had a bad camera, but I was doing some googling and discovered that apparently this is a popular problem. Since so many other users are experiencing the same issue, I've decided to live with it rather than wasting time sending it in for a repair, and being without a camera.I am thankful that I purchased a back-up battery, and I keep an extra fully-charged battery on hand at all times, just in case. But for the price I paid for this camera, I didn't expect to have these kinds of issues.***If anyone else has experienced this problem, please comment on this review and let me know if you took any steps to have it resolved. Thanks.***

Reviews.Title: Best snap and shoot for dummies....
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I borrowed my mother's P510 and fell in love with it... I just had to have one....  Even though this camera is an easy point and shoot, it can be complex too... I LOVE this camera...it takes beautiful pictures and the zoom lens is magnificent!!  I recommend this to first timers and people who do not want to buy all those durn lenses!!  LOL  One day I might get a DSLR but I love this camera for now...  You won't regret buying it!

Reviews.Title: Best one
Reviews.Author: Narwant
Reviews.Content: Loved this camera, purchased extra battery/charger kit to keep it going all the time. Ordered an external flash with mount bracket for extended reach in nights.

Reviews.Title: Battery life
Reviews.Author: Gin
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with my P510.  One thing I will point out the battery life is short, make sure you have two spares.I am using my camera mainly for photographing birds with good results, shots of birds in flight can also be accomplished.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera.
Reviews.Author: Bruce Sobocinski
Reviews.Content: This is a great advanced point and shoot camera. It works very well and has a great price point. I use this camera at all types of events.

Reviews.Title: So far, I'm really enjoying it!
Reviews.Author: Adam E.
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for a couple of months now. Greatest pros for me: easy to use and much lighter than any of the other cameras I tried. It also has a good grip. I know, because I've used it single handedly while holding onto my squirming 3 year old or while baking with one hand full of flour, or on the beach while propping myself up on the sand.It takes clear pictures, fun to use the zoom and it captures motion pretty quickly and without much if any blur. I still haven't figured out all of it's abilities, but I'm still playing around.The flash is powerful and helps pictures turn out vibrant not washed out.

Reviews.Title: Loving it as I learn it
Reviews.Author: E.L.
Reviews.Content: I only have point and shoot experience. I got this to use at the kids sporting events. I've used it to capture football and soccer action. The sport mode is great. Good at stopping the action and multiple shots. The zoom is great. I got a cheap tripod for long shots but have since determined that I am better off without it. I have been able to get clear face shots through lineman's face masks from the upper bleachers. Brother in law used it once and is now buying one too. I would buy it again even at a higher price.

Reviews.Title: Coolpix p510
Reviews.Author: Phil
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent, light-weight camera capable of taking surprisingly sharp and bright long telephoto and macro images.  A bonus is it's ability to shoot high definition video with on-camera stereo microphones.  It has lots of options for user control of images with as much or as little automation as the photographer would like.  Things the camera is lacking are a hot shoe flash or pc jack, a jack for external microphones for video, and a longer-lived battery.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME camera!
Reviews.Author: In the Deep Quiet Night
Reviews.Content: I absolutely LOVE my Nikon P510!  I was teetering between this one and the DSLR.  I'm SO glad that I purchased this camera!  I just LOVE the 42x zoom that it has!  The picture quality is GREAT and I'm learning how to do the manual settings!  This does have some DSLR settings, but it's not a DSLR.  Also, I cannot override the aperture setting and leave the f-stop on 3.0.  It automatically moves, so I can't always guarantee a soft/blurry background.  I have not had any problems with this camera and I HIGHLY recommend it.  As a former photo lab technician for Walmart, I was exposed to various cameras (no pun intended).  Needless to say, Nikon wins hands down.Pros:1) 42x zoom--awesome!2) turns on fast3) manual settings for me to play with4) takes excellent photos5) not lugging around all the lenses :)Cons:1) cannot leave the aperture setting to 3.0 for the f-stop to keep the background soft/blurry2) cannot take extremely close pictures with the camera--it does not focus on the macro setting to very close unfortunately :(  i just LOVE my close up pictures3) manual settings can be hard to get used to--I'm still toying with them trying to figure out which ones to use and what ISO levels to put them on, etc.Overall, an excellent camera.  Unfortunately, we don't have the capability to post a photo as an example of what this camera can do.  But it's oh so fun for me!  Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Jade "KyoSohmaHatesLeeks"
Reviews.Content: I asked my husband for a camera for Christmas. After weeks of looking at cameras, he picked this one out. I am an amateur with photography, so I was wanting a nice camera that took beautiful pictures, rather than just a standard digital camera such as the Cybershot (which was disappointing). He did well! Of course it does not hurt that the color is red either (my fav!).  The first thing I noticed when taking it out of the box was that it came with a lens cover, a tether (handy!) and the neck strap. I never had anything that required all these items so I carefully combed through the book to make sure I had all the pieces and set it up correctly. Additionally, the initial charge took several hours. I read some people stated that it took only two hours, but mine took closer to 3.5 or 4 hours. I had a decent battery life that lasted two days of traveling and taking pictures of the family Christmas events. I love the zoom capabilities and were able to take shots a block away from the house of a neighbors dog, and it came out crystal clear! However the only downside is that it does not focus automatically upon zooming, so I have not recieved a clear picture until after I took it. There had been some good advice from other users on here on what settings to use to speed up the focus so I will try it. Overall, BEAUTIFUL camera, very nice feel and VERY comfortable to hold, lightweight, easy to carry and great for a beginner such as myself.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Kristian Dugan
Reviews.Content: Pros:Good quality feelNice displayGreat imagesAmazing zoom, while retaining excellent quality picturesThe scene modes are awesome!HD videoPriceCons:Can take some time focusing when zoomed in farGPS can take a while to lock in.Conclusion:This camera is a great choice. I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Many pluses, one BIG minus
Reviews.Author: Buddypal123
Reviews.Content: I have neck and shoulder problems so lugging a heavy camera case with multiple lenses is not an option for me.  I wanted something I could loop the strap over my neck for safety but basically hold the camera in one hand while I hike and sightsee.  Here are the POSITIVES: 1.  Does GREAT in low light situations which was the reason I was looking for a new camera. 2) THe zoom does a great job of hand held stabilization, even at it's highest setting, for general use.  3) It is very comfortable to hold and carry.  The rubberized grip is great for hot sweaty climates. And for all it does, it isn't too heavy. 4)  The tilt LCD screen is fantastic for many situations, particularly for shooting over a crowd, down low when I don't want to get dirty, upward angled shots, or surreptitious travel shots of locals. I held it way over my head and angled down for some cool Christmas pictures. I normally use the view finder, but now that I have the tilt screen would never go back to a camera that does not have this feature; I am amazed how many opportunities I find to use this.  5) The new battery  lasted for 400 shots over several hours of on/off, zooming in and out, and leaving on till it slept.  The zoom is so powerful that it takes a lot of battery to extend it that far so as I always carry backup batteries. I was happy with that.  The NEGATIVES: 1) I detest the on/off button.  there are 2 close together, it is slightly recessed, and I have trouble finding it without looking.  Several times I caught myself hitting the FUNCTION button instead and got frustrated as shots passed me by.  It is sluggish to turn on. 2)  The zoom is sluggish to respond.  3) Twice, the camera has frozen and become unable to focus till I powered off/on.  I missed a few second opportunity to catch a tiger in the wild due to this problem.  I got the shot with my iphone instead.  I'm still bitter. 4)  This is my BIGGEST complaint.  The colors are not saturated.  My photos look slightly washed out.  This was confirmed against several other cameras. My sister and I hiked together in the autumn woods, her little Kodak took better photos of side by side shots. (I'm talking color here).  I carried both my old SONY  DSC-H50 and the Nikon out in my back fields and compared colors.  The Nikon lost again.  And while in India my traveling companion had a small pocket Olympus with a Leica lens that she was shooting with.  I backed up all her photos with mine on my ipad and was frustrated that her colors were more intense.  THis was across the spectrum.  Since I've been home and have edited the pictures with iphoto to boost the color or saturate more I am happier with the pictures, but I shouldn't HAVE to do that.  5) The menu to work around your features isn't very intuitive.  It took me quite a while to remember how to get to the options that I most used.  Overall, I am happy.  There is so much that is great about this camera.  But the color misses the mark.  I tried many cameras in the store and this one felt the most comfortable in my hand.  It felt at home and not too heavy.  But I travel a lot and color is a huge part of my experience.  So my quest for the perfect camera goes on.

Reviews.Title: The best camera!
Reviews.Author: Asdis
Reviews.Content: I have always owned some "small" cameras  but now I really wanted to buy a "real" one.  I tried this camera after a friend of mine had bought it and I was totally in love!  So as soon as I could, I bought it myself and BOY, OH BOY... The photos from it are gorgeous!  I tell all my friends about it and if someone is about to buy a camera of that size, I convince him/her about this great one!  Thanks a lot for it!

Reviews.Title: Best ever
Reviews.Author: Magoo
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after being on vacation with a friend who had  the cool pix 500, I  was using a Cannon EOS with the separate long lens and there was no comparison, this Nikon is the easiest to use, lightweight and has great features.  The pictures are great and the zoom is better than I could have expected, definitely happy with the product!qq

Reviews.Title: ♥♥♥♥ Love it ♥♥♥♥
Reviews.Author: Michelle Gable
Reviews.Content: I have been looking for a decent mid-level DSLR that is both easy to use but also has some higher capabilities. Oh, and it all has to be affordable too. This Nikon Coolpix P510 fits my bill. While I will own up to using the automated features quite often, I really wanted the ability to easily perform manual adjustments to my images. The Shutter and Aperture modes are quick and easy to access and utilize. Very simple. The image quality is amazing and the zoom is excellent. Amazed I can get wildlife photos from a fair distance that seem like I'm right next to them. I really love the tilt out display. It has made some awkward camera angles very easy. I'm no longer raising the camera and hoping the shot was well composed. The red body style is simply an aesthetic choice. Everyone has a big black camera.

Reviews.Title: Excelent, I love it !!!
Reviews.Author: Ricardo Soto Soto
Reviews.Content: Easy to handle, I am 64 and for me is difficult to carry all my previous lenses,with the p510 I am back on steep hills. Images  are pretty sharp. I am enjoin it a lot.

Reviews.Title: LOVE THE FEATURES
Reviews.Author: Mitzypoo
Reviews.Content: Very happy so far with this camera, love all the features and I learn something new about every time I use it.  The quality is GREAT.  I suppose professionals need more than a point & shoot but with 42x zoom plus 16 megapixels it's great for me

Reviews.Title: Best camera
Reviews.Author: Dawn Dickinson
Reviews.Content: Absolutely love my new Nikon P510. the 42x zoom is unbelievable. Tons of extra features that i hopefully will use. But the camera in itself is excellent and would strongly recommend.

Reviews.Title: GREAT Camera!!!!
Reviews.Author: Penny G. Oconnell "Penny Gentry OConnell"
Reviews.Content: Absolutely LOVE this camera.  I started practicing with it right away, without even reading the manual, just with the automatic feature.  Went out to my back yard and started zooming in on hummingbirds, squirrels, birds, you name it.  Needless to say, after using the zoom on a most beautimas ruby throated hummingbird, and seeing the sheen in the little bird's eye, I was tickled pink with the clarity!  Very happy with this camera!

Reviews.Title: Amazing Camera
Reviews.Author: cruisequeen
Reviews.Content: I only have had this camera for a little over a month, but have taken some beautiful photos with it already.  I do own another "bridged" camera (different make) so I am a little familiar with this type of camera.  I am very impressed with the results of the "outside" shots I have taken.  I haven't taken any shots inside yet.  The photos I have taken are of popular photographed areas and objects.  I think my photos are as good as any other amature.  I have been reading the manual that I printed from the PDF.  This is a requirement if you want to understand all that this camera can do and operate the camera correctly.  It is really amazing what it can do for a "bridged" camera and the price for this camera is wonderful.  I have had SLR's in the past, but didn't want to haul all that equipment around again.  I wanted a camera that could give me "professional" looking photos without all of that costly equipment of a DSLR.  If you are looking for more professional and extensive processed-photos, then you may want to get a DSLR.  But I think this is the perfect camera for someone who loves to take "professional" looking photos without the big investment of the DSLR.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: SG
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a camera for the average user, look no further... this is the one. Great pictures, user friendly and self explanatory to the intuitive individual, light, compact and powerful. I work in the real estate business and I needed a camera that I could use for listing pictures of properties in addition to personal family activities with my kids. The picture quality is outstanding. It's fast, has a screen that bends for capturing views in difficult angles and has a better size than the comparable competitors, for instance Canon. The only issue is the price, it could be somewhat less expensive, but on the other hand you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Sharlet Smith
Reviews.Content: Oh my goodness I LOVE this camera!  It's not too complicated...but takes awesome pics!  Wow!  I was afraid it would be heavy...NOT.  I can set it on auto OR decide to go manual.  YOU need this camera!

Reviews.Title: super camera
Reviews.Author: D. Whaley "ARC Nurse"
Reviews.Content: Love the color.  Nice camera, easy to use, good size to carry everywhere.Have only use a few times but have been happy with pictures.  Speed is great.

Reviews.Title: Cool Camera
Reviews.Author: Kathy
Reviews.Content: A few weeks ago I purchased the Nikon CoolPix P510 to replace a Nikon CoolPIX P100 that took an hard unfortunate tumble on the floor while the lens was fully extended.I reviewed the P510 camera on Amazon and compared it to others in its class. I then went to Best Buy where i could touch it and try it out. Unfortunately they only had the black one and it was cheap looking compared to the P100 that I had previously. I continued to research the camera and after many hours of comparison I decided that the only thing that was holding me back was the cheap appearance of the body of the camera, hence I decided on the red one and I love it!!!It has an incredible 42X wide zoom, there are many special effects that are very easy to use. HD video requires one button touch. Video is good but one does lose clarity if tracking a fast moving object. I read several reviews that pointed out the battery life was very limited, however I always charge the battery before I leave for a photo event and have never had it run down on my during my shooting session which will be off and on for several hours. It has GPS but I have not used that. It is a great camera for the serious amateur photographer! I paid $408, free shipping and recieved it in 2 days to my doorstep. No regrets.

Reviews.Title: Love the Nikon p510
Reviews.Author: Stanley W Oleszkowicz "Stan Oles"
Reviews.Content: This camera is unbelievable.  The 42X zoom with the stabalizer is great.  Still working through the features and enjoying very good photography.  Discovering and experimenting with all this camera can do is nothing but pure fun. The only cons are the battery charging must be done with the battery in the camera.  There are inexpensive chargers that can be peuchased seperatly.  It's a little larger than I expected, but all is forgiven with all its capabilities.

Reviews.Title: Nikon P5100 - Great Versatility in a Compact Size
Reviews.Author: David C. Edsall
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera only weeks before leaving on a cruise/tour to Alaska.  While I had limited time to learn the use of all its features, it worked great in "auto", and most of the features are similar to those of other such cameras.  I bought the camera because of its 42Xs optical zoom would make it ideal for travel and possibly make it useful for birding.  The camera it replaced had only a 15Xs zoom which I increased to about 30Xs with a rather cumbersome conversion lens.  I also found the buttons for various features more conveniently placed on this camera than on the one it replaced.While I have not had a chance to review all the pictures taken on my recent trip, it does seem that I have deleted fewer pictures due to camera shake and poor focus than those with my previous camera.  Overall it was great.If I had one criticism of it, it would be that it takes too many seconds to power up.  But this would probably be true for any digital camera.

Reviews.Title: Poor video and picture quality
Reviews.Author: George Alvarez
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera at Costco for our first new born baby. I was going back and forth between a Nikon DSLR or this point and shoot. I decided to go for the Nikon P510 for having good reviews and being able to carry around. I started shooting pics and video as soon as the baby was born.  The video quality is nothing close to full HD as the camera states. Also when ever there is motion or baby is moving and I take a picture, that area is blurry.  When I try to zoom in and take a close up, the image is blurry again and not that great. This camera is going back and getting my self a full DSLR.

Reviews.Title: A FUN LITTLE CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Mary Dickinson "Legal maven"
Reviews.Content: I collect cameras, and photography is my hobby. I shoot w/ a Canon 40D and still rely on my Canon xti. I have a Leica point and shoot and a Lumix LX3  ( the best camera ever for outdoor landscape shooting). Because I have arthritis, it is difficult at times to lug mey larger lenses around. I researched the Canon, Lumix and Nikon point and shoot cameras w/ extended zoom capicity. I concluded that the Nikon P510 would be the best choice. The price was a factor b/c I did not want to spend $500+ when $300 would get essentially the same result: a fun point and shoot w/ extended zoom and workable movie capacity.I am so impressed with the Menu. By far, this is the most user friendly set-up of ANY camera I have ever owned. This is simply a fun camera to use and actually provides great photos...really! The zoom is great for outdoor use, and the photos I have taken inside are crisp and clean. I have kept the ISO no higher than 400, and have not shot much in shutter in low light,  but apture is just fine. True, the body is rather light/more plastic that metal/but this is OK, as I am not hard on my equipment. I'll leave it to the pros to tell others what to purchase and why, but I have found over the years that one camera does not fit all. My Canon Power Shoot 100 is wonderful to have at my disposal when my granddaughter is around. The 40D is well the 40D and has served me w/ distinction. The Lumix LX 3 is unsurpassed as a point and shoot for the  outside. This Nikon is a great all-around camera with a zoom that is tops. The best advice I can offer is to decide what you like to shoot, and then do your homework. Read all that you can about your camera choices b/4 you purchase anything. Do not be impulsive!November 29, 2012:Just received Alexander White's guide book for the P510. A fun/must read. He has done an excellent job with his other guide books, and this one is no exception. Listen, the P510 has limitations, but for a exceptional "all around" take along camera..this is it. One more thing...low light pictures are perfect/I mean perfect.

Reviews.Title: Pleased So Far !!
Reviews.Author: Tom
Reviews.Content: I'm strictly an amateur when it comes to photo equipment - but went on vacation a week after receiving this camera, and was very pleased with it. Did a crash course in it's use - and the photos came out crisp and clear - and the video function worked great as well. Set it up just for optical zoom in filming wildlife, and got some great shots both in photo & video mode. Word of advice - get the better batteries as advertised on the camera's sale page - and bought a 32 GB card - had tons of space for content and only had to recharge one battery in a week's worth of use (and always had the second battery and the one it came with for a backup). Some reviews griped about the focusing time - which I didn't find to be an issue - just have to get used to using it, which took a very short time - and the pay off was the quality of the photos. I took a chance in buying this camera - and totally lucked out in my choice !!!

Reviews.Title: Sold the HX100, bought and returned the P510 for the SX50.
Reviews.Author: Yogi Moore "YogiM"
Reviews.Content: Camera reviews are tough - its all very subjective. I owned and sold the Sony HX100 for the soft images at the max zoom. I did (and still very much do!) like the Sony innovations of HHT, AMB, and the panorama modes. Wow, but not quite The One Ultrazoom. I loved the GIU of the Sony Cybershots. The AMB is one of the coolest things around!Enter the Nikon P510. The P510 is surprisingly small and light. It has HHT and the panorama but not the dedicated AMB, which by the way is a multi-shot mode that reduces motion blur during a sports event, etc, by using the other 5 shots to modify the first. Smart and although similar to the HHT (pumps up the ISO instead), has a different purpose. Problem is that the P510 is also soft at the high end. Perhaps a bit sharper than the HX100 but still soft. Slow for the burst modes. Blurry and crappy EVF. Battery life was short as well. The body is big enough to hold a bigger battery (hint, hint, Nikon...).Returned the Nikon and now happy with the Canon SX50. Sharper shots, pretty good speed and an effective HHT (although hidden in the SCENE mode). However, the SX50 does NOT have the panorama mode (!??!?!). It acquires the shots but does not do the in-camera stitching. SHAME on Canon, its like they didn't want to pay for the license. Although I like the Canon multi-shot options (best shot select, SNR averaging), its only available in the AUTO mode and cannot be selected - arrggh.What do the P510 and the SX50 really need? A much better EVF and the auto EVF to screen eye-activated switch. Once you see the FZ200 and that nice EVF, these two cams pale in comparison.I'd pay for a better EVF, guys. If you are going to push the optical zoom to 40X +, then please provide a useable EVF.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, except.....
Reviews.Author: Nar Gar "NG"
Reviews.Content: ... except a major design flaw.The zooming/focusing motor sound is loudly audible when recording video. If not for this, I'd give this camera a five-star rating.Putting the mics inside the camera body, come on Nikon - of course it was going to pick up motor sounds.I am not returning this camera for the unprecedented 42x optical zoom only.Panasonic Lumix FZ150 is a MUCH better choice - and its mics are actually in the flash popup.

Reviews.Title: I may have got a bad one, but my is horrible
Reviews.Author: Lynda Anderson
Reviews.Content: I've used Nikons, both film and digital for over 15 years, and have supplied my employees, children, and grandchildren with them as I thought they were the best available anywhere.With the Nikon Coolpix P510, my mind has changed. I'm a Real Estate Appraiser and take on average anywhere between 25 and 60 pictures every day. Because they get beat up by so much use, I generally have a less expensive camera for work and maintain my Nikon Digital SLR for personal use. When my Coolpix 300 series camera finally died after 5 years or so of hard use, I bought this one. After less than two weeks, I noticed that at least half of my pictures turned out blurry, something that has never happened with any of my digital cameras in the past. In my opinion, it's not acceptable... especially in a Nikon that's supposed to have all kinds of vibration reduction built in.A call was made to a Nikon service representative, and they asked for six copies of the photos, half blurry, half not, and said I would hear back from them within 24 hours. Five days later, I finally had to call them back, and they hadn't even looked at the photos, and didn't even want the "reference number" I'd been assigned. Chelsea in the "customer service department" had a response that was unbelievable. After examining the photos, she said everything was fine, and I just needed to reset the camera to the factory settings, not change them and be sure to take all pictures at 1/60 sec, and also be sure there wasn't too much light.Well, sorry, Nikon. I buy your cameras to use. That doesn't work for me. The camera has now been returned and I'm going with Canon from here on out.If you buy one of these, hope yours works, but I would look elsewhere. Not only is the camera bad, but the customer service at Nikon is appalling.

Reviews.Title: Burry pictures
Reviews.Author: cheryl
Reviews.Content: I am a canon fan, always have been and the way it is going always will be.  I bought this camera because of the zoom  but I am hugely disappointed in it.  I took almost 500 pictures over the course of a week and in over 3/4 of pictures at least one person or items in every shot were blurry beyond being able to use the photo for anything.  This was true if I used the zoom or if I didn't use the zoom.  I returned the camera and went and bought a canon powershot sx 40 and I am very happy! No blurry pictures with the canon.

Reviews.Title: good carmera
Reviews.Author: Verne Brown
Reviews.Content: Dose most of what I wish it too. Battery life is ok...though when runns out it goes now..besure to have a backup or two.  Would be good if had a hotplug for off camera flash. Zoom is good ,

Reviews.Title: Extremely nice point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Dennis Derocherr
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a very sharp point and shoot this camera is incredible. I have captured some really fine photo's with this camera. Do your homework but this is a fun little camera to own and use.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: luvtohike
Reviews.Content: Great point/shoot camera, it goes where I go, long range zoom, lots of MP, fairly reasonable, easy to recharge, batterylife is good, lots of options on the camera

Reviews.Title: Very good Camera for Bigginers !
Reviews.Author: Mohammed Almeshari
Reviews.Content: I have used this camera ,,, it has a very good zoom ,,, no need for more lenses ,, just have this camera and it is very good for low price and Bigginers cameras ,,,, I love it !

Reviews.Title: GREAT CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Tomp
Reviews.Content: Basically this camera is just awesome! The zoom is incredible and it takes really clear photos. I really like how the screen puts out so if your taking a picture higher up or down below its much easier. The controls are easy once you get used to them. It has a few filters you can use. The flash is really good. I can light up an entire dark room with it. The one thing I really wish this camera had was auto-zoom. I have to go into manual zoom every time I take a video. Other then that is a great camera for the price.

Reviews.Title: Wow what a great camera
Reviews.Author: Ingrid Hansen "alutiq"
Reviews.Content: I like the convenience of a point and shoot camera but needed a little more.  I've been using Kodak and Olympus, this camera's lens is much better than either of the comparable models. I highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Camera
Reviews.Author: Jonathan Alexander
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera for my fiance for Christmas and she absolutely loves it. I am amazed with the quality of pictures and video that this thing can produce and now my fiance's camera is the envy of all her scrap booking and picture taking family. Money well spent.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: Corgi Girl "Jacqueline Bell"
Reviews.Content: I am a bird watcher and the 42x zoom is perfect for my long range bird shots. Way too heavy and cumbersome to use as a video camera

Reviews.Title: Next best thing to a digital SLR.
Reviews.Author: jppjr.
Reviews.Content: This camera is terrific!.  The best features of a digital SLR are incorperated in it.  I like that it has an eyepiece as well as a screen. This helps keep the camera steady when you are zooming way out.  It is a bit more complicated than the usual Nikons but nothing too confusing.

Reviews.Title: wow! Best pics under 700$$
Reviews.Author: eric gray
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my wife over a year ago. Weve had many plays etc and we can sit in the back row and record in high def with the AMAZING lens on this thing! I wanted to get her a removable lens camera, but the cheapest at the time was 700 to 800$, and thats a cheapie! So get a cheap slr with low options etc and 500$ lens to buy in future, or get top of the line compact with all the options for couple hundred less?? Could not be happier, me and my wife completely recommend this camera. And its alot cheaper then when I bought mine.

Reviews.Title: Best camera out there!
Reviews.Author: Dave
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera from another store about 2 years ago.  Recently, our daughter started showing great interest in photography -- so we looked to get her a camera of her own for Christmas.  After pouring over specs and reviews...nothing matched the Coolpix P510 for quality, features or price.  So we bought hers on Amazon as a refurbished unit.  Even more, my brother-in-law was looking for a camera for their family and I recommended this one to them.  They love it too!  I hope this remains available as a refurbished item for a long time...nothing else on the market has matched it!

Reviews.Title: LOVE THIS CAMERA....FINALLY CLEAR PICTURES
Reviews.Author: kam orley
Reviews.Content: So far I am loving this camera....a lot to learn bit shooting it on automatic already has made picture taking easy. I love it....

Reviews.Title: Nikon is excellent!
Reviews.Author: Gui Ramos
Reviews.Content: Bought for a friend of mine who is a photographer (he uses this one when he isn't working, as he has a much better one, also from Nikon at his job) and he is having a blast with it!

Reviews.Title: Nikon COOLPIX P5 10 camera
Reviews.Author: KR
Reviews.Content: I like the camera very much does everything it's supposed to do the only reason I deducted one star was because of the poor handling and shipping and tracking it took approximately 10 days to ship the camera 900 miles .the only thing I dislike about the camera is the slow automatic focusing on most photos you have to readjust focusing

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Di
Reviews.Content: I have really enjoyed using the Coolpix 510, it has so many capabilities and produces quality photos.  I have had many good comments on my photos.  I feel having the viewfinder makes getting quality shots much easier, at least for me.  I would recommend this camera to anyone looking for a mid-size camera.  I've have always used Canon cameras from SLR's to digital and find this Nikon an easy transition from one brand to another.

Reviews.Title: happy
Reviews.Author: TONYA CARNES
Reviews.Content: The product is exactly what I wanted my family pics have come out great! I am finally able to capture all the great moments

Reviews.Title: Great prices compared to store.
Reviews.Author: JB
Reviews.Content: Other than loving the camera for the "smile" timer setting and the pull-away screen, the price on this baby is great. It was on sale at Target for around $500, but I saved $200 buying it on Amazon. Shipping was fast too!

Reviews.Title: awesome camera
Reviews.Author: J. Prato
Reviews.Content: At 42x zoom and 16 mp what is not to like on this camera?  This is the best camera I have owned to date.  Got a discount on a refurb model, and it works perfect.

Reviews.Title: Nikon COOLPIX P510 16.1 MP Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: BellaNugosi
Reviews.Content: This is a really GREAT camera.  For those wanting to move up from just a point and shoot camera with out spending lots of $$$ this unit is for you.  It has a great zoom and excellent optics. It is easy to use and can be used just like a point and shoot or can be set to be used more as a "professional" camera.  The lens is not detachable, so don't buy it if you want interchangable lenses.  Also has settings to enhance and retouch your  photos.  Easily interfaces with the computer for photo transfers.  You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for me.
Reviews.Author: TGregory
Reviews.Content: I could not have chosen a better camera for all around spontaneous shooting.  The 42x Zoom has let me get some fantastic shots I would have missed without it.  I like the way the LCD tilts a lot.  The newer version I believe swings out sideways and looks more awkward.  The Auto setting seems to work just fine for almost any shot but I do occasionally use the manual ones.The auto focus seemed to be an issue with some of the other reviews before I purchased it.  The camera does not know you are through zooming so press the "shoot" button halfway down and the camera will immediately focus for that distance.  It will focus on its own but that takes longer.So far as value and the convenience of not carrying a big heavy bag around with multiple lens, I could not have found a better camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Loretta Watkins
Reviews.Content: I bought this strictly for the 42x zoom because I enjoy wildlife photography and I haven't been disappointed. It does an excellent job (when my hands are steady enough, that is). I've gotten photos of hummingbirds, deer, indigo buntings, woodpeckers, squirrels, all kinds of great shots of things I only tried to capture before and was disapointed because I just couldn't zoom in enough. Well worth the cost--and it's gone down about $50 since I bought it in September 2012. It takes great pictures of the moon, too. I just didn't want to bother with changing out lenses and lugging all that DSLR equipment around, having to set the shots up and taking too long, etc. This is the perfect camera for someone who's a serious amateur photographer without a lot of money and time to fuss with accessories.

Reviews.Title: Great for indoor pics
Reviews.Author: Holly Miller
Reviews.Content: This camera takes excellent indoor pictures, which is the majority of what I take.  I bought it because the other reviewers indicated it was great for indoors.  It has lived up to the quality they said, and I love it!  It was very easy to figure out how to take pictures. I haven't tried all the extra features... Maybe one day I will get out the manual and figure out how to use them.  Right now I just turn it on and snap pictures of the kids. I do get a little impatient sometimes with the buttons...they take a few more seconds to work than I am used to with other cameras.  But that is the only negative thing I can say about it.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding camera!
Reviews.Author: Erik Fredmonsky
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my wife and she absolutely loves it.  I was previously looking at several cameras in the $500 range but talked to someone knowledgeable in cameras and they recommended this one.  That person has several very high end cameras and bought this camera after reading reviews and they were thoroughly impressed.  That was enough to sway me into buying this one and I'm glad I did.  This camera doesn't have extra lenses to carry around like higher-end cameras, and we still get outstanding pictures.  I also showed the camera to another friend who is 'camera smart' and as they were testing it out they were practically giggling as they were taking high res, close ups pics from across the room.We've had the camera for a couple months now and have used it at baseball games, summer day trips, indoor birthday parties and it is an excellent camera. No blur, quick reaction time, tons of features...highly recommend for the everyday to moderate camera user.

Reviews.Title: Awesome zoom. GPS takes too long.
Reviews.Author: heywatchit
Reviews.Content: Like many people I got tired of lugging around my DSLR and found I was taking the vast majority of my photos with my iPhone. I needed something better than a compact point and shoot. As it is well documented here the zoom is phenomenal. Combined with image stabilization you can take some incredible shots. Battery life could be better and more importantly a warning (20%, 10%, 5%, etc.) would be a big help. Why don't cameras have these warnings like smart phones? My biggest pet peeve is how long it takes the GPS to register. Seriously it's like 5 minutes. If you want to have your photos tagged with the location you have to remember to turn it on WAAAAY before you plan on taking photos. Lame.

Reviews.Title: Not a point and click
Reviews.Author: Traci J. Alwardt
Reviews.Content: This USA great camera it just takes some work to figure out. The focusing art takes some practice. You cannot just point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: Good camera.
Reviews.Author: xuhong zeng
Reviews.Content: Pros:1. Good image quality. 2. Video captured is good. 3. Easy to use.Cons:1. A little big in travel.

Reviews.Title: nikon coolpix p510
Reviews.Author: Glenn Weber
Reviews.Content: my favorite camera.best camera I have ever owned.super easy to use.usually I need to carry manual with camera's in the past.especially when I haven't used in awhile.not this one.everything is laid out for easy understanding and makes it a breeze to work and function.the zoom is unbelievable!had trouble using in concert I went to  taking pictures not using the flash.didn't think by band being 100 ft. away it would ever reach the stage but with spot lights on  the band pictures were coming out white on lead performer? started trying everything I could think of.tryed turning on the flash and that was the trick.don't understand cause no way flash could reach all the way to the stage but guess on automatic camera sets it self up for the picture.once I did that perfect pictures again.was told using camera where lens can't be removed and interchanged almost all concerts will let this type camera in.takes fantastic pictures!!!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I researched for a new camera at a decent price. I have purchased many items from Amazon and have always been pleased. I am not a professional with a camera,but this is so easy to use and the pics are great.  Recommend this camera !

Reviews.Title: absolutely love this camera
Reviews.Author: ruth patience "moral momma"
Reviews.Content: great camera. Works as described, and I love the quality of the photos. It comes with a disc that you can download to your computer, and use to edit your photos. I love this! It makes all my pictures look even better, if possible ;) Contrast and Brightness are my faves. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: LOVE THIS!
Reviews.Author: G8trMom09 "G8trMom09"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera as a replacement for my Nikon DSLR camera.  This is my second Coolpix and the one I should have purchased instead of the DSLR.  Works exactly as described and is perfect for the pro hobbyist photographer.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: L. Conley "GroceryGamer"
Reviews.Content: Didnt know what the expect when i got the camera. At first i was disapointed in the auto functions, the sport mode was still taking blurry photos but after learning the aspects of the manual mode I absolutely LOVE this camera!

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix P510
Reviews.Author: IRWIN BECNEL
Reviews.Content: Great camera. The only problem is slow GPS. The GPS was one of the key reasons I bought it. Everything else about the camera is outstanding. As others have reported, battery life is short, but extra batteries and external chargers are cheap and easy to find on Amazon and Ebay.

Reviews.Title: Great beginners camera
Reviews.Author: Leonardo J. A. M "Leonardo Sanchez"
Reviews.Content: I gotta say I'm impressed with this little guy,  the zoom is just amazing. I know is a fixed lens, and maybe the quality could be better for clearer images, but let's face it; if you're a professional you're not going to buy a $300 camera. It has lots of really good features, it has a better range than the usual 14 - 45mm  at close range is really good, makes it easy to take panoramas (it has it's own panorama function.. besides its great range).  The only "problem" would be the noise with low light, but I mean, really low light. night pictures are OK. I'm really happy with this camera, to bad it doesn't support raw, but is great even for small professional events, I know is not the best idea, but the lens and it's functions.. at this price is a great deal, you can fix the small details with photoshop anyway he he.  I really recommend this camera :D

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for Christmas and I love it! It takes really clear and awesome pictures. The only thing I would say is that the shutter speed even on the fastest setting is still a tiny bit too slow sometimes when trying to catch an action shot, but other than that it is perfect!

Reviews.Title: Great camera, impressive photos
Reviews.Author: Cyntheea "Cyntheea"
Reviews.Content: I have owned many different brands of cameras, but of all I think this has been the best. The picture quality and ease of use are fantastic. I'm still learning many of the features, but have taken some great portrait and landscape shots with this camera.

Reviews.Title: The last.
Reviews.Author: Yin "giraffe crazed"
Reviews.Content: This will be the last camera I purchase, at least until it stops working. It is more camera than I will ever need for my travels. Am still learning all it can do with the help of the guide, trial and error. I am not a big time photographer and this camera is about as sophisticated as I can handle.

Reviews.Title: I've only owned it a few hours....
Reviews.Author: treewoman
Reviews.Content: This is definitely a PRELIMINARY review...I've only owned this camera for a few hours. I did a few days research and decided this was the best step-up for me from a pocket-sized point and shoot, to a more complex camera with options, but not ready for a DSLR.  I ordered it on Thursday, was supposed to be delivered on the following Monday, but I got it today, Friday.  Kudos to Amazon for the fast shipping!It took about 3 hours to fully charge the battery, and then I was out shooting on "Auto" and trying it out.  It feels like it's well made, definitely much lighter than the old SLR I owned in the 80's and 90's.  It has a very nice feel to it, as far as fitting in your hand, and so far, most of the controls seem to be fairly logical.  It is laid out similar to my old, tiny, Nikon Coolpix point and shoot, so I'm somewhat familiar with the basics.  I didn't really need the full capabilities of the 42x zoom today...but when I did try to zoom all the way out, I can see you might want a tripod.I could only take pictures here in my house and in the yard this evening...but so far, so good.  No, not everything was perfect, but then I"m just playing around and I know it will take me quite a bit of practice to get farther than the Auto setting!  However, I can see that even if you never went beyond Auto, you would get good quality pictures. I always got compliments on my photos that I took on my point and shoot, but the difference in quality with this camera is amazing. Also, the software for downloading is good- very similar to what I was used to, with more options.  I've been very happy with my past Nikon cameras and their software, and it looks like this camera will offer the same quality I have become used to.I am looking forward to experimenting a lot with this camera in the future, and learning all I can about it.  I did order the book Photographers Guide to the Nikon Coolpix P510  (very highly rated on Amazon), because I want something I can carry with me while I am learning how to use this camera, and not have to refer to a computer-based reference manual.  The Quick Start Guide that comes with the camera gets you started...but just barely. My biggest complaint with ANY new appliance/item/camera I have bought in the last several years is having the instruction manual online...or even downloaded on my computer.  If I have to sit in the woods with my laptop to figure out how to work my camera...then forget it.  I need a book I can refer to.  Besides...I own a cabin in the woods where there is no internet, so if the manual is online via the internet, I'm out of luck!Ok, got off the subject a bit...just venting!Anyway, first impressions- very good.  I will update this after I have had the camera for awhile, but for now I'm very happy with my purchase and very impressed with the quality of the pictures I have taken.  I think the price I paid ($299 on Amazon) was a deal.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful Camera
Reviews.Author: Janie
Reviews.Content: I really like this camera.  It is easy to use and takes great pictures.  The pictures are a better quality than the Canon Rebel Ti1 that I have and will be donating to a good cause!!The camera on amazon.com is NOT the one you get.  Yes, the camera is the same, but the company that actually sells the camera has it in all black and not red.  I really, really wanted  a red camera, so I was very disappointed.  That company was very nice, as they contacted me by e-mail and told me about the discrepancy and even gave me a chance to cancel the order.  I was desperate to get the camera, however, as I had a deadline to meet with taking some pictures.  So, I got the black one that looks like all my other cameras!!I like this camera so much that I will be using it for all my photography needs--here at our Christmas business and travel.

Reviews.Title: GREAT!
Reviews.Author: Robin Leist
Reviews.Content: I've only had the camera for about a month. I still don't know half of what I can do with it. But I've taken a lot of wildlife photos and close-ups and I love this camera. I'm looking forward to learning more of what it can do. I got it on sale for $299. I did buy a glass protective screen cover for the 3 inch screen. It's by Polaroid and I'd recommend it. The camera is small and lightweight considering all it can do. I've always had Canon.....which I think they are great also...but I'm really impressed with this Nikon. I've got to have a view finder besides the 3 inch screen and this has both. The telephoto can capture things very far away without getting blurry. Any way...it's nice.

Reviews.Title: One great camera that is easy to use and takes amazing photos!
Reviews.Author: A. Wells
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because I wanted more than a point and shoot, but didn't want to pay the high price for a DSLR. This camera has been a lot of fun to use and it takes stunning photos. I recently travelled to Berlin and Istanbul and the pictures I took have impressed a lot of people not only because of the subject of the photos, but the tremendous detail and quality of shot. My point and shoot would have been such a let down. Glad I had this Nikon with my on my trip.I couldn't be more happy with the camera and plan on taking a photography class to learn more about how to use all the features available. I think this has been one of the best purchases I have made in a long time.

Reviews.Title: Buy this camera
Reviews.Author: Bradle Bradle
Reviews.Content: I've had two Olympus digital cameras and one Fuji. I still cannot believe the amazing picture quality that a camera of this price brings. The zoom is mind shattering. I was able to zoom in over a mile away. If you want a camera without the price tag of thousands of dollars this is the one.

Reviews.Title: excellent camera
Reviews.Author: Ines
Reviews.Content: excellent camera. it is perfect to use in your trips. i took the best photos with this camera. i totally recommended

Reviews.Title: a really nice camera but...
Reviews.Author: stumpedI
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  The only problem with it is the infinity setting on max zoom is out of focus.  Manual focus must be used and that's not quick nor easy to set up.  The auto focus WILL focus on the moon and if your lucky an airplane if it's close enough.  far away tiny objects like planes and stars tho you must use manual focus as auto focus cannot see them.  If you you tube the camera you can see that the only real issues with this camera are focus issues.  There also is no filter thread on the lens.  slow motion playback is limited to 4x . There are also some video settings where the exposure is not modified during filming.  Ie you cannot change brightness as you film or you will really notice it in playback.  Other than those drawbacks it takes nice pic's.  It is loaded with options.  You can easily catch 4 moons of Jupiter with this camera.  At least if your in new england usa.  Still looking for saturn.  Bottom line tho is i am pleased with this camera.  despite the focus drawbacks it is the best camera i have ever owned.

Reviews.Title: Very nice camera
Reviews.Author: Angel's Helper
Reviews.Content: We purchased this camera because of the Nikon reputation.  We are not professional photographers and didn't think a DSLR would be right for us, but liked the option of manual focus if we so chose.  The pics are bright and vivid, especially in outdoor lighting.  The only problem we are having is that our young granddaughter's photos are ofter blurred because she is always in motion.  We have not taken the time to read the accompanying booklet in detail.  Still subjects' picture quality is amazing.  There may be a better mode to take children's pics in.  We still need to do some reading and research.  Otherwise, the pics are definitely more crisp than with our older Sony camera.  All in all, we are quite happy with this Nikon and hope to enjoy it for years to come.

Reviews.Title: I love this Camera
Reviews.Author: Sarrah
Reviews.Content: Well I would first like to say that it, like everything else that I have ordered from amazon, got here before the 'estimated delivery date'. The picture quaity is amazing, and the things I can get with the 42x zoom is mind blowing. I really love this camera.

Reviews.Title: Nikon COOLPIX P510 is pretty good.
Reviews.Author: Lobo
Reviews.Content: Nikon COOLPIX is pretty good.More then likely all I will ever need, but they do have a little better one out now called Nikon COOLPIX P520.

Reviews.Title: Very Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Fernanda Felippelli Cecchin
Reviews.Content: I'd love this camera. I could take beautilful picturesIt is weightless and easy to use.It is worth buying

Reviews.Title: BEST SUPERZOOM CAMERA I OWN.
Reviews.Author: A. C. Lima "NAGUAL MD"
Reviews.Content: I do collect superzoom digital cameras and have done my homework on the subject.The wide angle lens is a plus.,the color capture is brilliant and with good contrast.The only negative feature is that the autozoom is slow.Worth every cent.

Reviews.Title: WOW!
Reviews.Author: S. Mccosker
Reviews.Content: I can not tell you how happy I am with this camera!  I just printed out my Easter photos and they are so clear. It is light weight, easy to use, everything I was looking for.

Reviews.Title: Daughters Birthday present - WOW was she thrilled
Reviews.Author: RubiconRider
Reviews.Content: Our first Nikon Camera...have always been a fan of the Panasonic Lumix line.  So far the pictures look great on screen and printed.  Haven't yet tested the gps functionality, but don't really care about it one way or the other.  Was disappointed that a filters can not be installed on the cameras lens and hence only gave it 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera at a Great Price
Reviews.Author: V. Hall
Reviews.Content: For anyone who is relatively inexperienced with digital photography, this camera has it all.  It's a great little camera that does a big job.  Wouild make a great gift!

Reviews.Title: Great.
Reviews.Author: Garland E. Criswell
Reviews.Content: Enjoying using my new camera. Lots of things to learn about its operation. I have taken a lot of photos with it.

Reviews.Title: Excelent
Reviews.Author: yorman
Reviews.Content: is an excellent product! with good resolution, various great features when capturing photos and videos. the screen is perfect draw to take several angles. I recommend it!

Reviews.Title: Very good!
Reviews.Author: NICOLAS
Reviews.Content: This camera has completely cover my needs. The image quality is beautiful, LCD screen is more than I expected. I recommend this camera for those need a very good zoom, good quality for any time, considering it's a Point and shoot camera not a DSLR. I'm using this for "plane spotting" in the headers of airports runways and the results had been very good.

Reviews.Title: Great cameras for the price!
Reviews.Author: JCR
Reviews.Content: I like simple things and this camera provides ease of use in a highly capable product. I am not a professional photographer, nor do I really know much about cameras in general. I've owned 5-6 digital cameras over the years and this camera the best. If you're looking for a great mid-level camera that won't break the bank, a Nikon Coolpix P510 is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Choice
Reviews.Author: Rafael E. Díaz Rivas
Reviews.Content: It is one of the most wonderful cameras I ever brought.  Very Special.  I am really enjoying every time I take a picture because every day I find something new in it.  Not 5 because de Gps Device does not work as I will like

Reviews.Title: Merry Christmas to me!
Reviews.Author: Christine Jann
Reviews.Content: I LOVE LOVE LOVE this camera.  VERY easy to use.  Would recommend the SanDisk Ultra 16 GB or higher Memory card and extra batteries!

Reviews.Title: not a professional but easy to figure out
Reviews.Author: Stela Pen "Stela"
Reviews.Content: Good quality and resolution.I don't know if because today we are so used with electronics but this one is easy to figure out how to use without reading the manual. Fair list of languague settings which is handy for foreign.Color is nice.Not a professional photographer but I guess this is a cadillac for who is used only to take regular pictures on the cell phone.It doesn't come with memory card, you need to buy one.

Reviews.Title: Like the Camera, Hate Nikon Customer Service.
Reviews.Author: Lynne Hammonds
Reviews.Content: Camera was less than a year old when the lens went out and never retracted. The problem was user error as I turned it on before removing the cap. So I sent it in for repairs. They only way that I could do this was to PREPAID the changes for repair, which I did. Now I am getting a letter saying that I have to pay the same amount AGAIN and approve to have it repairded .Wouldn't you think that sending them the camera and the money was approval? So I called them and still waiting for a call back, I hope I live long enoughI think this will be my last Nikon product as there is no intelligent life beyond the sales department.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera overall.......
Reviews.Author: William Allen
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for a recent vacation.  Overall we love the camera.  The only reason it only got 4 stars instead of 5 is that the focus on this camera suck in low light.  If you take a lot of low light pictures, even with flash, I would recommend looking elsewhere for a camera.  Otherwise this camera has a great zoom and crisp photos.  Many features you would find on an SLR, like the manual settings, but at a fraction of the cost.  Like the size of the camera...smaller than an SLR, but still big enough to feel solid in the hands.

Reviews.Title: Lovely
Reviews.Author: Hema
Reviews.Content: This product is Awesome and time flies away easily when i get started with nikon coolpix each time. The clarity is absolutely amazing for a point an shoot camera !!!!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Michael W. Wayne
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for my wife for Christmas.  This is our first Nikon, and it takes fabulous pictures.  The zoom is unbelieveable.  The features are just what we were looking for in a point & shoot with many advanced selections.  It fills the bill for the novice or experienced user alike.  Now, how can I get it away from her?

Reviews.Title: Excellent!!
Reviews.Author: Arla Ide
Reviews.Content: Love the feel of this camera.  It is easy to handle.  I'm very impressed with the zoom feature.  I tend to take a lot of close-ups and am very picky.  With this camera I am satisfied.  :)  Thanks for a great product!!

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Ronda
Reviews.Content: Really like this camera.  Pictures are amazing and clear.  I was looking for not a heavy camera like the real expensive models but something more than the point and shoot.  Wasn't disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix P510
Reviews.Author: carolyn webb
Reviews.Content: Excellent  camera for hiking and all outdoor use in the mountains.  Easy to set up, easy to use with very little instruction.  Manual is simplified for those that hate to read manuals.  Take great photos and most important has a viewfinder.  Never leave home without one.  Good for entry level photo buffs or even pros, you can do a lot with it, and it's worth every cent I paid.

Reviews.Title: CoolPix P510 $400
Reviews.Author: C. Wong
Reviews.Content: Good for aim and shoot.Pictures were very sharp and good for telephoto.A little slow to focus on telephoto shots.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Jam
Reviews.Content: Great camera, people say you get what you pay for, in this case it's not true. You get many awesome DSLR futures for friction of DSLR price, not mentioning spending another $300-$400 for extra lens to get zoom like that. Bottom line I'm very satisfied with this camera, great pictures and options. You can take pictures in dark places without flash.

Reviews.Title: Great lens on this camera
Reviews.Author: William M. Verebely, Jr.
Reviews.Content: Took the camera whale watching in Virginia Beach. Was able to zoom in on the whales as they surfaced quite a distance away. Got great shots. With it being 16 meg pxl. I was able to crop and enlarge the whale photos with great quality and sharpness. Bought a second one for my wife.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Tony G
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best cameras I have owned. I have had some very good camera equipment from 35mm, to DSLR to miniature cameras. This product does video and excellent photos. Really happy with the product and all the available options. I have taken some great pictures with this and only needed one hand to do it. The flip screen that can be adjusted to pretty much any angle is perfect so you can raise the camera well over your head and use the viewscreen to still see what you are shooting. Love it.

Reviews.Title: The ideal small camera
Reviews.Author: orlandofurioso
Reviews.Content: The P510 probably has all the features that most people would ever need. I was able to image the Gallilean(sp) satellites around Jupiter. Also was able to image sunspots by using a piece of welders glass.

Reviews.Title: I've always loved Nikon cameras and this one looks as good as the pictures it  takes....
Reviews.Author: BLB  Hobe Sound
Reviews.Content: As a prior Nikon owner, I always loved them.  My last camera wasn't a Nikon and I was never pleased with it.  I kept droolingover the camera section and decided it was time.I'm a novice with the P510 so it will be awhile before I'm proficient.  So far I have been very satisfied with the photos I'vetaken and I know I've only scratched the surface.  I'm looking forward to learning more and taking movies also.I know that the quality of the camera is top notch and is not at all affected by the color of the camera,,,,but....I love mycolor!!!  To me, it is bright and makes me feel good....

Reviews.Title: Nikon P510
Reviews.Author: tlm
Reviews.Content: Great camera! Love it. Zoom lens is remarkable. Very impressed with the way it feels. Adjustable viewfinder is very handy. Great features, great price. Get one.

Reviews.Title: As always, Nikon is a great value!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "The Oregon Business Coach"
Reviews.Content: I bought two CoolPix P510 cameras, one for myself and one for my photographically talented :-) daughter.  I have not yet mastered my camera but generally I am very pleased with the results I've seen.  I won't get all technical on you except to say that this camera generally seems smarter than I am.  Most of the time I'm just leaving in it the mode where the camera decides the scene and optimizes that way.Some other reviews have mentioned a few defects: telephoto focus and battery life.  Let me comment on battery life-- Usually I leave flash disabled and I've not noticed a short battery life.  At a recent Christmas dinner I turned flash on and I did find the battery running down pretty quickly.
