BTW I have noticed that the battery indicator shows "full" until maybe 15 minutes before you're out of juice.  I'd really prefer more warning than that!  Back to the battery life: I'd just leave the flash off-- In many cases because of the sophistication of this camera you won't need it as much as you expect!I initially thought I had a problem with focus in telephoto mode until I realized that it was only when my subject was closer than the minimum focus distance of the telephoto; I could focus on objects that were far away but not my up-close subject.  Having used telephotos this is to be expected.  And with the zoom range of this camera it's easy to be in an extreme mode without realizing it-- This lens zooms from 28mm to 1000mm equivalent /before/ switching to digital zoom!  With great power comes great responsibility!Speaking of the zoom-- this camera works pretty well handheld -- even in zoom mode -- when the room lighting is decent!  Of course it can't do the impossible but it does surprisingly well if you are even just a bit careful.I wish there was a good body case for this camera.  I also wish the strap were either just a bit longer or that there was a hand version of the strap.  Be careful to follow the directions when you attach the strap or it may come loose and the camera will fall.  (Fortunately in my case the fall was very short!)Recommended!

Reviews.Title: About as good as point and shoot gets
Reviews.Author: monsieurms "monsieurms"
Reviews.Content: The pace of technology is amazing. I imagine this camera would seem like magic to someone just 20 years or so ago. It is well built, intuitive, takes sharp photos and includes options galore. The picture modes are great. The panorama feature at 180 is exceptional, very good at 360, too. The burst mode in various scene settings helps pictures be better. Built-in effects like sepia, high/low key, monochrome and delete-all-color-but-one work great. It even tells you if someone seemed to blink as you took the shot. Magic indeed. Ultimately, though, it is about the basic act of taking pictures. They were sharp and clear from 24 - 1000.  The camera did a good job with automatic exposure selection, too. I also liked being able to save to a 16:9 format--that's my computer and my TV format. Why not? If you use the 2x digital zoom to go to 2000, even farther than the optical zoom allows, quality does degrade a bit (just like in the old days with extender lenses)--but if you need it, it's there. Controls are logically thought out with key items like close-up mode, exposure compensation, self-timer and flash menus available from a push of the rotator dial without having to dive through the internal menu system. Another similar and great touch is that when you focus and are in an automatic mode, you can adjust the F-stop/aperture program on the fly by just spinning a rotator dial to come up with a different combination, as light allows. Add GPS, support for full size SDXC cards, eye-fi, HD video and so on. There is not much missing here in a fixed lens camera. Some quibbles... The biggest con here is no filter thread. I'll live. It handles so many effects itself (not to mention software that does the rest), that all but the hard core can live without a set of effects filters. But seriously--what can possibly be the point to not having a filter thread on a camera that does so much and is intended to be one stop shopping for most? Just to have a chance to protect the lens if nothing else, a filter would be nice. It would've been nice as well if it took AA batteries for versatility instead of lith-ion, but that's a quibble, too. Also, it comes with a charger that lets you charge the battery IN the camera, but  no travel charger that lets you charge an extra battery all by itself. It would be nice to have both, but that, too, is a minor quibble and a rational choice to keep prices down as (a)there are, if desired, plenty of chargers (and extra batteries) on Amazon and elsewhere at modest prices and (b)on most routine trips and shooting moments, most people probably will not run the battery down unless they use the playback and picture editing features intensively; and (c) if they do run the battery down, they probably can live with in-camera charging that happens rarely at inconvenient times. More intense or more paranoid folks (that's me!) should invest the modest sum of $15-$20 in a travel charger and an extra battery. Overall--this is a brilliant camera that allows a user to be pretty serious while leaving a camera bag full of lenses home.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera for the price!
Reviews.Author: TheCat
Reviews.Content: First off let me say that I am not a Photographer guru or even a camera guru, that being said. This camera is AWESOME. Once I read the manual I was off and about taking great pictures with ease. The macro zoom is amazing and I got some really cool pictures of bugs on flowers. And Tonight if the sky is clear I'm going to do the Moon shot everyone does with it. Only thing when taking a very high shutter rate camera it took me awhile to figure out how to get the flash to work with it and my pictures kept coming in dark (well for us noobs). Other then that Awesome.

Reviews.Title: Nikon COOLPIK - a great Camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: The camera is BEAUTIFUL.  The picture does not do it justice.  I liked everything about the camera, and my grand-daughter,who received it as a Christmas present was so excited when she opened the package.  There was no other rating that wouldwork for this camera (except maybe a higher one).  If you are interested in taking good pics, this camera is for you!

Reviews.Title: This is a terrific camera!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This camera takes amazingly clear photos, no matter how far out I zoom. I bought it because of its zoom capability and have not been disappointed!

Reviews.Title: More camera than I bargained for!!!
Reviews.Author: Richard Fortner
Reviews.Content: Completely satisfied with the camera.  It has more capabilities than I know how to use, but I intend to learn.  Would recommend this camera for the point and shoot crowd as well as those wanting a bit more.

Reviews.Title: Review of Nikon CoolPix P510
Reviews.Author: Edward M Albert
Reviews.Content: the camera does most everything that a SLR would do and is lighter in weight. The instruction book could stand improving to discribe all the features and how to use them.My camera did not come withe a lens cap strap.

Reviews.Title: Gift for a loved one
Reviews.Author: James
Reviews.Content: I looked at at least a hundred camera for a birthday gift for my wife and she needed a new camera ( she let me know any chance she could) and i could not be happier with this camera! the pictures are fantastic and the video shoots in HD  which is almost unheard of in other camera i looked at. the zoom is the main reason for loving this camera and why i bought it because i didn't want to go and buy lenses that would have to be changed for a particular outing with the family. This camera has a EXCELLENT one built directly in the camera (if settled correctly) the image adjusts to the zoom feature. in other words if your looking for a great quality camera that give professional result this is for you.

Reviews.Title: Nice
Reviews.Author: John C.
Reviews.Content: I have not had the camera too long but so far I definitely would recommend it. The picture quality is great, the camera has a nice quality feel to it and the zoom is fantastic. The Nikon battery provides approximately 200 shots on a charge. One thing that I believe that Nikon did wrong was not include an external charger. The charger that is included with the camera forces you to charge the battery in the camera, some may be ok with that, I prefer not to. There are quality brand name options available for external chargers that don't break the bank.

Reviews.Title: I love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Pat "dawgfancy"
Reviews.Content: I haven't had a really good camera in years, and decided to get this one after my husband raved about his higher end Nikon.  I knew I didn't need one like his, and after researching other Nikon's decided on this.  I haven't regretted this decision at all!  Easy to use, outstanding pictures, + the red is really a neat color.

Reviews.Title: One of the best wide angle & long zoom digicams
Reviews.Author: MATT  WERNER
Reviews.Content: I'm a serious photographer & own many (including D-SLR) cameras, both Nikon & Canon. I did research before buying this Electronic Viewfinder (EVF) camera. I've taken it on vacation and used it for critical photography.  It is one of the best I've used in a long time.  Here is the good & bad in bullet points:PROS:  excellent image quality, built in special effects, many scene options, small/light body, easy to use menus, BSS (=Best-Shot-Selector: camera takes up to 10 shots & only keeps the *sharpest* one), amazing zoom range (from: wide angle to tele, approximately 24mm to 1,000mm), affordable price, ability to use Shutter priority, Aperature priority or full Manual control, small battery, built in GPS/geo-tagging location of your shot.CONS: unique battery does not last long (buy extras!!), flash is weak, no flash shoe f/aux flash, auto-focus can be slow in very low light.Not too bad considering, all-in-all the P-510 is a GREAT digicam.

Reviews.Title: amazing!
Reviews.Author: Kdgum
Reviews.Content: I'll admit, I wasn't too sure about this camera at first. Rec'd it as an early Christmas gift from my parents.  It took some time to figure out as I have only been using my iphone camera lately.  After spending a good hour with my husband playing around with it and setting the user settings, I started snapping pics here n there.  Pretty darn good but deal breaker came this morning. I took our dog out @ 6am, decided to try the nightscape view to snap a picture of the moon. I zoomed all the way to maximum, snapped the pic, and WOW!  I am AMAZED, I can't say that enough, AMAZED!!!! You can see the craters on the flippin moon!  I will try to attach my picture here when I get home but holy canoli! I showed it to my husband and he was just as amazed!  Now I know this is only considered a "compact" digital camera but for the price and the picture quality, you can't beat it, IMO!  I am so impressed with the shot I got.

Reviews.Title: Love the Zoom
Reviews.Author: Ronald E. Malmfeldt
Reviews.Content: Wanted a compact camera with long zoom for up close and personal photos in China and SE Asia, without being obnoxious.  I was able to take very satisfactory photos from moving vehicles, as well as under a variety of lighting conditions.  There are a limited number of f-stops to work with, but a wide range of shutter speeds allows excellent compensation.

Reviews.Title: travels in Nepal
Reviews.Author: tini
Reviews.Content: Have been travelling in the Himalays for 35 years with all my Nikon products...camera, lenses etc and now at the age of 66 I needed a good camera with little weight and no extra lenses.  this camera was amazing.  Please check out some of my photos at maximal lens distance.  It's is hard to focus if you don't have a tri pod, but I did have a mono pod that doubled as a hiking stick.Does not process as fast as most of my other great Nikons but all in all it was great!  Cant imagine going back to the bigger cameras at my age and what I do.  /Users/info/Pictures/iPhoto Library/Masters/2012/11/09/20121109-074413/DSCN0272.JPG/Users/info/Pictures/iPhoto Library/Previews/2012/11/11/20121111-051150/JSNaXutbTKeKTdMOdLmOlg/DSCN0621.JPG/Users/info/Pictures/iPhoto Library/Masters/2012/11/11/20121111-051150/DSCN0486.JPG

Reviews.Title: far from pro photographer
Reviews.Author: Cheryl Elj
Reviews.Content: I just got this today and brought it to my daughters skating practice.  It was bright in there but the action shots I got were fabulous!  Love the zoom on it.  I took pics of her across the rink and they are clear as can be!  I'm waiting to try it out in a little darker environment such as on a stage.  While using it tonight, I clicked several times and some came out blurry but I was able to get clear shots while zoomed. I'll update later, after I've had a chance to play with it a little more and learn the settings!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Maxine Macko
Reviews.Content: I find this camera to be true to all the customers comments. This a great camera. The body is a nice fit in the hand. Not to heavy. Love the zoom. You can take it right out of the box and start shooting. Loads of settings.

Reviews.Title: Good camera...
Reviews.Author: Martin
Reviews.Content: works fine and takes good pictures, 42X zoom its excellent for sports and nature pictures, amazing panorama  photos, and have a nice special effects.

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: kjr
Reviews.Content: i have a couple of other cameras including a 45x zoom camcorder.i bought it for the zoom due to the fact im in the private investigation field.easy to use.i like the sound quality when using the movie function on playback with my tv.pictures are very nice and clear.

Reviews.Title: LOVE THIS CAMERA!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I don't know why I waited so long to make my decision on this camera.  I researched many cameras and after much delibriation bought the coolpix P510 and I could not be happier.  It can zoom in on a gnat's eyelash miles away!  It is a bit heavy but that is because all your lenses are built into it.  It takes great shots and has many choices.  I find no complaints.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Ginger
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a camera in a moderate price range from $250 to $500 with good features without weighing a lot and having lots of lenses to carry around. This has met all my expectations. It's easy to use and takes good pictures in a variety of modes. I especially like having a viewfinder in addition to the screen mode. That's especially helpful in bright sunlight.

Reviews.Title: love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Kelly L. Chase
Reviews.Content: This camera is perfect for me. I am using it to shoot photos of my family and pets. Its lightweight when hanging from my neck, solid, and has amazing picture quality! I did have my heart set on the Nikon coolpix l810 because of its price and features, and I still think I would have been happy with that choice! However, what I've found to be a big difference is the batteries. The p510 takes a lithium ion battery whereas the p810 requires 4 AA batteries. I would much rather have the longer lasting lithium ion that is rechargeable. It comes with a USB charger, so you can charge it in your car, and for $15 here on Amazon, you can buy a backup battery and travel charging unit combo! I just don't like the idea of being out, snapping away and suddenly needing to find a convenience store to buy some extra AAs to keep shooting. This camera has AMAZING color quality, faster shutter speed, captured photos way faster speeds, a viewfinder, and captures 1080p movies (and yes, like other reviews have stated, you CAN hear the zoom on video playback, but I can overlook that for all its other features) this was a wonderful option for me and I highly recommend it! If its a bit out of your price range for home/family photos, I still recommend the Nikon L810

Reviews.Title: great camera for the price!
Reviews.Author: mokh
Reviews.Content: everything works perfectly with this cam! tons of options, VERY close to a DSLR. Zoom is incredible. A couple of glitches though, but I wasnt surprised since I read about them in reviews before. It takes around 20 seconds to focus on full zoom, and the gps does a take a bit to get a location. But thats not a problem for me. Overall its a good camera, I upgraded to this from a Kodak Z981 and its worth it!

Reviews.Title: Best Camera I Have Ever Owned
Reviews.Author: raelneegjione
Reviews.Content: Granted I haven't owned many cameras, this camera is great! Half point and shoot and half SLR. Takes great pictures, beautiful quality and it has so many ettings for all the perfect thing. It can get very confusing so I suggest to read the disk of instructions, it is very helpful. After reaading it, it made it easier and more fun to use!

Reviews.Title: nice pics, but...
Reviews.Author: A. talebian "AST"
Reviews.Content: The picture quality is insanely awesome. Also the video quality is very good. However there are 2 things that i do not like about this camera.1. Battery life sucks, get off-brand extra ones2. while taking video you should not use the zoom becuase it is very noisy and you can hear the loud zoom. (i did not buy this camera for video so i am not really mad)overall, i love this thing:)

Reviews.Title: Great pics
Reviews.Author: teacher
Reviews.Content: I am enjoying the ease of using this camera and I am very pleased with the clarity of the pictures and videos.Have not tried all the functions yet...plan to. If you like to use a camera quickly, when setting it to "auto" as you learn to use the other modes, there is no problem with this camera producing good quality photos.

Reviews.Title: Best camera in the market!!!
Reviews.Author: Michel
Reviews.Content: This is the best camera in the market, with all qualities you could ever think of. The zoom just makes everyone crazy and the functions are just perfect, you can take professional photos in different enviroments without any or not much undertsanding of cameras. BUY it now!!!!

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix P510 Best yet
Reviews.Author: CJ
Reviews.Content: This camera is Great so far I have had a lot of point and shoot camera's (kodaks & Canons) and this one is the best, I'm always looking for more zoom and good features and to be able to control the focus on a point shoot for the money this is Awesome! I took some sun set picture's the other day and it really catches the real cools, and used the zoom to get some great bird picture's. Everything I have tried so far has worked Great. I would recommend this camera to every one!

Reviews.Title: I love this Camera!
Reviews.Author: Jasmine
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera for the price (I got it for $399 free shipping and NO tax). I see people talking about the focusing but I have no problems with it. I have taken amazing pictures of the moon and other things at full zoom and they were clear as can be. I am not a professional photographer but this camera makes my pictures look amazing!

Reviews.Title: good product
Reviews.Author: newdaydawning
Reviews.Content: have been very satisfied with this camera. pictures are outstanding. 1080p is great. I did take both at a low light (similar to what you would find at a nightclub) wedding reception without a flash and the pics came out anywhere from good to excellent. I did have to make adjustments with software on the 1080p video because of the low light.  this was the first time I had used the camera in a low light situation - I believe things will come out better the next time because I think a large part of it was me. I like the size of the camera; it's not one of those tiny little things that you fumble around with. It feels good in your hands.

Reviews.Title: A good camera with a nice zoom
Reviews.Author: Slide4180
Reviews.Content: Pros-Takes very good pictures (and isn't that the point of a camera).-Best digital zoom I've seen (and first I've bothered to keep enabled).-Good autofocusI've taken a few hundred snapshots and a few photos with the camera so far. My initial impressions are good.Cons-No filter threads-Awkward video recording-Manual controls confusing-Short battery life

Reviews.Title: Disappointed with Nikon P510
Reviews.Author: Eva "Eva"
Reviews.Content: When My old Kodak Z740 finally broke (it was seven years old) I said to myself I will step up and get the photography industry leader a try even though I LOVED my Kodak. I was quite disappointed with the overall quality of the pictures - especially the clarity. All the pictures seemed to have a milky haze over them - my Kodak was so crisp and clear and it was only 5 Megapixels! I couldn't understand it. I did take all the pictures in Auto mode and did not give the manual settings a chance - but I took my all my pics with the Kodak in auto - so I just didn't have the heart to try it if the Auto was already so disappointing. I have since ordered a Kodak Z990 - it should be here in a few days - wish me luck.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Tim Wood
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera to replace my Sony Cyber-shot DSC-HX200V camera. I had researched it and found it to be rated #2 in the bridge camera catergory on a couple of websites and was impressed with the zoom capabilities advertised, whereas my sony was rated #4 or #5. So upon receipt of the camera I did a test between my very well used Sony and the new Nikon expecting some extraordinary differences between, especially regarding the zoom. I was sorely disappointed. The Nikon has a much louder lens sound, was noticeably lighter in weight making for more movement in my shots and the zoom was not comparable to my Sony which has a 30x zoom as opposed to the Nikons 42x. The shot recovery time of the Nikon was less than the Sony, but sacrificing photo quality for a second or two recovery time is absolutely not what I was looking for. My suggestion for anyone preparing to purchase a good bridge camera spend the extra money and get the Sony Cyber Shot DSC=HX200V... many more features, better photos, feels more like a solid quality built camera... I love my Sony even though it has been through the ringer it is still the best camera I've owned and I will keep using it until I can find one that can out perform it hands down!!! Til then me and Sony are still on the photo circuit.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Jianqiang Zhong "Z Man"
Reviews.Content: I would like to find out whether it is my own fault. I love to like it but the camera's focus is just hard. I bought this for my coming canyon national parks trip and will use it extensively but for now, I have hard time focusing it. I will decide whether I will return it after the trip.I bought the red one but the coating is too shining for my taste; I wish I bought the black one which seems have better quality.Update:  It has bee long time after my canyon trips. I visited 6 national parks and used it extensively. As suggested by other, I used Target Finding AF mode, then it works better, however, once a while, I still have hard time getting it focus, specially when over 30x and once a while it froze. (folks, I used digital camera since it was first available in the market and bought many since.) For the price and lightness, I decided to settle with less zoom and keep it.  However, later on, I decided to return it for two reasons:  Do NOT bother to manually focus it, operating the "shifter" for focusing is frustrating. It zooms in and out too fast. Not like my canon camera, I can twist the len in and out to focus.  When playing the captured video, the audio like playing from a broken speaker, much worse than even a $100 point and shooter.

Reviews.Title: Nikon P510 Camera
Reviews.Author: DomC
Reviews.Content: I just returned from vacation and had a good chance to give this camera a workout. So far I am extremely satisfied with all the features I had a chance to use. It is extremely stable on long time shots and very quick compared to the digital camera I replaced. The only feature I don't like with this camera is, you have to manually raise the flash. Other than that I just love this camera. It's a lot of camera for the money.

Reviews.Title: Coolpix P510
Reviews.Author: Terri B "Montani Semper Liberi"
Reviews.Content: Loving this camera, but haven't figured everything about it out yet.  What I can say is that I took my son to view some bald eagles in the wild and we could not even see them in their nesting area with the naked eye, but the super-zoom on this camera allowed us to take some nice pictures.  Not close-ups because of the distance but we could indeed see and photograph the birds.  I gave the camera 4 stars because in less bright daylight, I seem to have a "haze" over my pictures BUT that may well be user error--I am not a pro photographer.  Also, you must remember to manually open the flash on this camera which is not a huge deal, but can be a minor annoyance.  I may not be a pro, BUT the pictures in daylight conditions turn out about as good as if I were a pro.  Overall, love the camera--probably the nicest point-and-shoot you can get.For another perspective of the zoom, I stood at my office building which is  elevated above street level and took a photograph of cars parked a block or so away and could zoom in and read the license plate #s and bumper stickers easily.Seller's shipping was prompt; packaging was appropriate.

Reviews.Title: Great simple camera
Reviews.Author: Mikepsr
Reviews.Content: I took this camera on a African safari, it took beautiful pictures. Very simple to use!I wanted something that I could use and not require me to have a PHD in photography. This camera is absolutely perfect for the average person that wants to take great pictures or movies. The zoom is all you need and you don't have to haul extra lenses.... I highly recommend this camera!

Reviews.Title: Pros and Cons
Reviews.Author: Abdulsalam
Reviews.Content: I have been using this camera for over six months. I will list the pros and cons that I have noticed so far.Pros:1. Easy to use.2. Support many languages, English, Arabic....etc.3. Quick in shooting and saving except in dark places.4. Really great zoom. You will be able to take clear pics for far things.5. I bought it for 400 which is really a great deal.Cons:1. Its battery does not last for a long time.2. It takes about 30 second to save pics that ware taking in dark places while the camera on "scene" mode.3. You cannot change the lens.

Reviews.Title: Why would anyone buy anything but this amazing camera?
Reviews.Author: Erin Leary "Erin"
Reviews.Content: I just got this camera.  The telephoto is amazing.  The wide angle is wide.  And all in one lens!  The panorama feature is incredible.  And it can take time-lapse movies.  I love it!

Reviews.Title: Nikon P 510
Reviews.Author: Pork and Beans "JES"
Reviews.Content: The latest in the Nikon line of cameras is proving to be a winner. It produces excellent images and is light weight for traveling. As an amateur photographer I am very pleased that I can take great photos and not have to tote multiple lenses on my travels.

Reviews.Title: best zoom
Reviews.Author: J. Gochenouer "loves the outdoors"
Reviews.Content: It has been years now and I still use this little puppy a lot.  I purchased a D600 with a 300 mm zoom and the P510 at maximum zoom gives me a better photo.  Not much.  But if you zoom in with Photoshop the D600 pixelates before the P510 does.  At 16meg, the images are professional quality if not cropped.  Usually I am working with the d600 now but for quick stuff, spur of the moment events, and as a back up camera this little guy really performs.  And it can take a beating.  I'm on the ocean a lot and surprised that it still works after all the banging around.

Reviews.Title: Tried it out in Iceland
Reviews.Author: Sheri
Reviews.Content: I still have not mastered this camera in terms of the manual settings, and I find it a bit slow...albeit perhaps I haven't figured out adjusting the shutter setting, but thus far my initial experience with this camera has been stellar. I wanted a high zoom camera to capture the landscape of Iceland and this camera did beautifully. The resolution and color is beautiful even from a far distance. Low light situations were surprisingly not very grainy at all. The photo imaging software it comes with doesn't appeal to me so I'm sticking with my iphoto format. Overall I love this camera and look forward to actualizing it's potential.

Reviews.Title: Very Pleased
Reviews.Author: R. Hurst
Reviews.Content: I have owned this for about 3 months now. I have used it primarily for distance shots - birds in trees. It does an incredible job. The image stabilization works and evens out my tremors at long range. I would give it 5 stars, but at the extreme zoom it takes a short time for the focus to settle down. Best to come back a short way on the zoom for the focus. Much quicker that way. Does a great job in low light and virtually don't use the flash. Forget the case it comes with. Get the Case Logic one for fixed larger lenses - even that is tight, but works. So far the battery is lasting a long time, but I bought the plug in charger with 2 extra batteries for travel. The LCD screen is extremely bright. I wanted the viewfinder when I bought this as I had been disappointed with the LCD on my previous camera in bright situations, but so far, this screen has not washed out enough to use the viewfinder. I generally use the scene mode, but I have been doing photo stuff for 6o years and am comfortable with all it's manual modes. Macro works beautifully. No real complaints and am looking forward to the Alaska trip we have planned. My guess is that the few 1 star ratings got lemons - certainly not the camera I have.Returned from Alaska trip and took 2500+ pictures and 20 minutes of video. Didn't come close to maxing out the 32 card I took. Problem that I had as did the 4 other people on our cruise that had the same camera (37 total people), the auto focus feature frequently stopped functioning and would have to reboot, turn camera off and on, to get it going. Missed a few shots because of that. Camera with its big telephoto was the envy of many for pulling in wildlife shots.

Reviews.Title: Nikon coolpix p510
Reviews.Author: Pat
Reviews.Content: I Love my camera. Having been a photographer for years and used manual 35mm cameras with interchangeable lenses and having to have accurate focus this is my dream camera. What a delight. Digital is so thrilling and fuss free. I am amazed at the quality of the photo's. I have only used it for a few weeks and introducing the extra features slowly but anxious to learn them all.  I bought a extra battery to have readily charged to change when needed which is something I have learned to do anyway. One has to be prepared.

Reviews.Title: SLR + point-and-shoot : The worst of both worlds.
Reviews.Author: H. Nguyen
Reviews.Content: Pros:- Great zoom.  Wide angle is great to have so easily accessible.- Feels nice in your hands.Cons:- Photo quality is very much like a standard point-and-shoot style camera (such as Canon Powershot, etc).  Somehow I thought it might be inbetween that and an SLR, but really it's not SLR-like at all.- If I were to view it as a point-and-shoot, then it's really bulky and heavy.- If I were to view it as an SLR, then the photo quality is pretty bad - you can't get much texture depth, everything seems a bit flat.  The photos I was able to get on this don't compare in the slightest to anything I've gotten from my SLRs.- Default expose settings are not great - I found that I very often had to change the expose to get a reasonable photo, which I never have to do on my point-and-shoot.

Reviews.Title: I love this camera and all its features, and especially its color.
Reviews.Author: Luigi
Reviews.Content: The free UPS ground shipping was alright, I ordered it during the winter holidays, so it seemed to take forever for its arrival (New York-Los Angeles), but business days are business days.When it finally arrived it came in a box, and the product was with air bags to prevent severe damage. The box itself seemed undamaged, so that's good to know after I found out that the lenses-cover (the cap) was inside its own little bag. No scratches on the lenses whatsoever thanks to the little box inside the big box, and I am very picky with that. So 5 stars on handling. The tracking information was not updated that often, I didn't hear of it for 3 days on its way to LA from NY. I finally heard of it after its arrival near LA, and it arrived 1 day earlier than estimated.The camera performs so nice.  I used to have the Olympus SP 800-UZ, so I got something to compare it to.The P510 has 16.1 MP, in contrast to the 14MP from the SP 800UZ,42x vs only 30xdetachable screen vs steady screen$347 vs $385? how ridiculous!!!http://www.amazon.com/Olympus-SP-800UZ-Digital-Camera-Stabilized/dp/B0031RGEVS/ref=sr_1_1?s=electronics&ie;=UTF8&qid;=1358402473&sr;=1-1&keywords;=olympus+sp+800+uzso both have the pretty much the same body building, I cannot tell you about which one "feels" better when it comes to grip, but the P510 has so many more buttons and functions than the SP800-UZ.The P510 outperforms the SP800-UZ in all the tests i can think of... except maybe for the Help button from the SP800-UZ which assists you in every item you highlight in the menu and tells you what the feature is, and when to use it best. Nevertheless, once you know what the buttons and settings are for, the P510 its a much easier to use camera.Another remarkable feature from the P510 is that you can record a video with sound and able to use the zoom. In the SP800-UZ, you have to choose between sound or zoom, which was a great disappointment.One really bad setback for the P510 is that since it is relatively new, its replacement batteries are relatively expensive, and for cameras with great zoom like this one or the Olympus SP800UZ or the Canon SX50, you have to buy at least 2 more batteries. If you use the video with microphone, zooming in and out, and with HD, you are going to drain the battery before you can use 2GB of memory.Talking about video, you are gonna have to be patient with the auto-focus if you are video-recording and you zoom to its max. It really takes a long time to bring the images into focus, it happens to both the P510 and the SP800-UZ, although the P510 seems to be better within the same range as the SP800-UZ for video-recording.I'm going to update more once I can make more test and be able to compare them better

Reviews.Title: Nikon brand must do better
Reviews.Author: Marigno
Reviews.Content: I really appreciate the brand since I have a Nikon D90 which completely satisfies me. I thought I'd give the P510 to my novia for Christmas. We took several pictures and enjoyed the great range of focal length that makes possible some shots otherwise impossible, the good color rendering, the good definition (not beyond 400 ISO). But we also saw a lack on GPS: it has no orentation sensor (the iPhone has), a noticeable distortion at the sides of the image and a critical focusing, impossible on moving subjects. The lens does not have the filter thread. I use a lot the polarizer so I didn't give up: I bought a circular polarizer, I worked it with a file for a couple of hours and created the evidences to frame it in the same spots where the lens cover fits. At the end I was able to mount the filter in a stable manner, aesthetically perfect. The first thing that was not immediately obvious is that having electronic viewfinders it is not so easy to polarize but you can do it; the second thing is that focusing is now more critical and impossible on long focal lengths despite the circular type of the polarizer. Conclusion: A firmware update may solve the focusing problem (with and without polarizer); it remains the lateral distortion that is a fairly common defect of cameras of this type; on D90 there is the update that solves this issue too, maybe it could be possible an update for p510 too. Nikon, it's up on you!

Reviews.Title: Nikon cool pix p510
Reviews.Author: Nancie "bookaholic"
Reviews.Content: my husband has a nikon d90 and I was starting to use it a bit more and found that it became quite heavy trekking around gardens all day. the friend I was going with recently purchased the p510 after our encouragement to look at Nikon. we took a picture of a heron in a tree side by side. with the zoom on this Nikon you could see every feather; amazing.  so after seeing her pix and reading all the amazon reviews, I bought it. I have to say, I prefer the eyepiece for shooting; I've never cared for the other way and initially thought I'd return it. but I keep playing with it and have gotten some amazing shots. it's no d90 but it is lightweight and takes great pictures. I do find it difficult to see in really bright light, even with eyepiece. there's still a lot for me to learn using this camera but all in all, I'm pleased.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Audrey
Reviews.Content: It is a great camera, the zoom is amazing and the quality of the pictures awsome, it is not perfect video sucks  in and out of focus but still a great camera specially for what i need it

Reviews.Title: Funtimes2012
Reviews.Author: Funtimes2012
Reviews.Content: LOVE THIS CAMERA!! Perfect for my little hobby!! Clear .. Precise and love the red color!I couldn't ask for a more perfect camera !!

Reviews.Title: Love the Camera
Reviews.Author: pugged
Reviews.Content: I REALLY like this camera.  I bought it for the super zoom, and the zoom is great.  I have had no problem with holding the camera steady to get great zoom pictures.  My only complaint is the lack of a way to attach filters or a lens hood.  I have been in photography as an amateur for over 40 years.  I would like to be able to attach filters such as skylight and polarizing, and a lens hood to prevent flare. I choose this camera because it did what I wanted without the need for extra lenses.  A DSLR would provide more options for wide angle shots, but this camera is perfect for me.  And the cost is MUCH less than a DSLR with additional lenses.  I have used ISO up to 6400 and am pleased with the result.  The images are not the greatest at that ISO, but I was able to capture images that I otherwise could not.  I would buy again.

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: ANGEL
Reviews.Content: EXCELENTE.

Reviews.Title: Great pictures but slightly poor quality
Reviews.Author: C. Otis "Disappointed_Cindy"
Reviews.Content: I really love this camera. It takes great pictures and is easy to use. The record button to take pictures is in a slightly awkward place to where I'm constantly accidentally hitting it and taking videos, but the picture quality makes up for this little annoyance. The really frustrating thing, however, is that on the very first use, the little rubber bad meant to help you grip the camera came right off. I probably only had taken 4 or 5 pictures at that point and it just feel right off. It was obvious that it was not well-attached and every time I tried to stick it back on, it fell right off again a few minutes later. Really disappointing for having paid so much for the camera. Makes me worry that more pieces will be breaking and falling off soon.

Reviews.Title: 100% recommended
Reviews.Author: Argenis Ortiz
Reviews.Content: The video quality is very impressive. This camera has great zoom and takes pictures very well in low light without flash but you have know a little bit about camera settings to adjust it properl

Reviews.Title: Great Camera even for Novice
Reviews.Author: Elaine Craig
Reviews.Content: Still learning.  This is my first camera that moves beyond what I call the "drop-in-your-pocket" basic point-and-shoot camera. So far I love it. I have been able to produce beautiful pictures in the automatic mode.  Can't wait to learn about all of the other features of the camera!

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Eric
Reviews.Content: I am a casual user of a camera and just like to capture life when it has it moments in higher quality than on a smart phone. This has a ton of settings that can really help you take good pictures. I love the quality of the pictures and the zoom is amazing. If you arnt a serious photographer that needs 10 different types of $1000 lenses then this will do just fine for all of your needs.

Reviews.Title: best camera
Reviews.Author: Annie "Annie"
Reviews.Content: fabulous camera, light in weight , tremendous stable zoom. This camera enables me to shoot distance like a fox running by, with clarity and speed.

Reviews.Title: P510
Reviews.Author: Janet R. Bills
Reviews.Content: So far I like this camera.  The zoom is great.  Have not used it much yet.  My daughter has one exactly like it.  She loves hers.  That is why I purchased this one.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera! Great Price!
Reviews.Author: Nelson Macias
Reviews.Content: Awesome pictures! Works great! Amazing quality pictures! Highly recommended! GREAT CAMERA GREAT PRICE! Perfect anniversary gift for my wife! Thank you

Reviews.Title: Be aware that you will receive a "grey market" item
Reviews.Author: Kim Ridley
Reviews.Content: I did not realize until I tried to register my new camera with Nikon that I had gotten what they call a grey market item.  Esentially, I was not able to register the camera.  I now know if a camera comes with instructions in a different language (mine came with Japanesse) and no warranty card, caution beware.  Other than that, I love my new camera.  Takes great pictures!

Reviews.Title: great service great product
Reviews.Author: Emi
Reviews.Content: awesome everything! Couldn't be happier with everything about this product. Customer service was the best. Totally would recommend this product from this supplier to everyone.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: stacey croslin
Reviews.Content: I love this camera, great battery life and pictures. The camera is very comfortable to hold and not too heavy.

Reviews.Title: Very pleased
Reviews.Author: angelsrone
Reviews.Content: Luv this camera was one of the best dissensions I have ever made in a camera really like how close it zooms

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: April Lankford
Reviews.Content: Works great.  Thanks!Great little camera.  Easy to handle, and isa nice second camera when I just want to keep it simple.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: Brian T Reeves
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my wife as a gift. It is very easy to use and it takes great pictures. The only problem we had was that the lens cap was missing. After submitting a claim, "Crawfords Superstore" mailed me a new lens cap.Very happy with this product.Now it's time to learn all of the extra stuff this camera does.Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: Best camera yet
Reviews.Author: chance
Reviews.Content: I wanted a "point and shoot" that would work for birding and flowers and this is it!  Recently, I recently expanded it's use while I was copying documents for use in ancestry; without using a flash the pictures were perfect

Reviews.Title: Great Compact Camera
Reviews.Author: Jerry West
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my brother, and he loves it.  He especially wanted a camera that had an extended range with the zoom, and this camera has a 42x zoom, which is a fantastic reach. He also found it relatively easy to learn how to use, which is a big plus.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: D. Triglia
Reviews.Content: My favorite feature is the 42x zoom lens which I also use as binoculars to see something far away even if I don't photograph it.  I am NOT a professional photographer, but I love this camera.

Reviews.Title: Excellent customer support
Reviews.Author: Edward J. Blotzer
Reviews.Content: I read the very large manual and it was quite easy to follow. I did this with the camera in front of me. I'd suggest this if you, like me, is not a professional photographer. I have used it successfully to take a few pics so far. The ones of the birds at the feeder are crisp and clean. I did have one question on how to get back to a specific screen and customer support fixed the problem quickly. I REALLY appreciate that the people on the other end speak perfect American English. I think they are actually in America which, to me, is a big plus.  I purchased the Case Logic DCB-404 Camera case and it fits perfectly and has plenty of room for supplies - batteries and memory cards. I'm really happy with the purchase and the price was better than in the local box store. It came quickly and packaged appropriately,

Reviews.Title: A GOOD CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Mercedes Mantilla
Reviews.Content: VERY GOOD CAMERA, UNFORTUNATELY LOST THE CHARGER AND HE COULD NOT GET IN MY COUNTRY HAS THE PERFECT SIZE AND IS EASY TO USE

Reviews.Title: Ok for snaps but not for making great photos
Reviews.Author: Bruce A. Fichelson "Movie Lover"
Reviews.Content: First, when you get above 300mm, it is very hard to achieve focus, and at 500, forget it! Too much noise as well. These superzooms are only good for your average family vacation shots. And for that I'd suggest one of the Lumix cameras over either Nikon or Canon. But, if you want to also get potential large prints, get an entry level DSLR and one or top top lenses instead.One caveat: I have settled on a pro DSLR,  a Nikon D800 and a pocket camera with great image quality, a Sony RX100ii. This latter is a fantastic camera, fits in your pocket, and you can add a flash. Once I decided it was a keeper, I found a digital viewfinder for it on Ebay at over $100 off retail and it is great!!! So, there you have it.

Reviews.Title: My favorite camera ever
Reviews.Author: JenP
Reviews.Content: It's not complicated. It doesn't demand mad photography skills.  And yet it takes these amazing pictures that have people asking me, "what kind of camera did you use?"  Honestly...I basically just pointed at my subject and snapped the picture. The other day I got a fantastic shot of a red-shouldered hawk that shows every detail of his feathers, his beak, his eyes...and all I did was stand under the tree and zoom in on the bird. I love this camera. Even better, I trust it.

Reviews.Title: Great camera & great service!
Reviews.Author: Pat
Reviews.Content: I have only used the camera a few times & it seems to be a great little camera.  They had here to me in three days. Extremely pleased with the service.

Reviews.Title: My favorite camera!
Reviews.Author: Sally Greenblatt
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  Wish they would have had it in the red.  Oh well.  It has so many goodies.  The zoom is a  close up lovers toy.  Birds don't have a chance, you can get them in flight and separate the feathers when you view it.  Love this camera.

Reviews.Title: For my money, this is the finest camera you can buy in this category and price range
Reviews.Author: Frank N. Hawkins
Reviews.Content: Just back from Burma for a photo shoot with my P510. It performed brilliantly and the pictures prove it. The flip up LED screen is an amazing feature that makes versatile shots more possible. The zoom is amazing and the color is great. It's not a perfect camera. I don't think any camera is. But for the money, this is a better camera than its successor the P520.

Reviews.Title: I love it! Easy to use!
Reviews.Author: Betsy K Shea
Reviews.Content: I can't wait to explore more of it's features and to take it out into the desert and take photos!!

Reviews.Title: I LOVE THIS CAMERA.
Reviews.Author: RHB.  I really appreciate having this game. i...
Reviews.Content: it makes clearer shots from a distance, and it's easy to edit the pictures I make. (I NEED TO DO THAT A LOT).

Reviews.Title: Love the Camera !
Reviews.Author: Nancy Stalter Hatfield
Reviews.Content: This camera is great.  It is perfect for me in that it is not too difficult to operate, yet it has all the "bells & whistles" that the more expensive camera's have.  It is the perfect size for me as it is not too heavy nor as bulky as some of the other camera's that I have owned in the past.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for an amatuer photographer.
Reviews.Author: GrizzlyGreen
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera at the start of my college photography class. This camera is perfect for a beginner and at a very reasonable price. My instructor was very impressed with it. I produced some terrific images with this camera, from macro to portrait. The 42x optical zoom is amazing. I love this camera and I highly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Really Nice
Reviews.Author: Carmen Medina
Reviews.Content: This is a Excelent Camera, The zoom is amazing and It have an excelent resolution. If you have a really good camera, This is it!

Reviews.Title: Doesn't get any better
Reviews.Author: Alembic1
Reviews.Content: Best Camera Ever Used! Absolutely amazing what it can do. Every time you use it, you learn another amazing feature not listed in the description.

Reviews.Title: Great pictures
Reviews.Author: motherx2
Reviews.Content: It takes great pictures. Very easy to use. The video is very good too, although it uses up the SD card very quick.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic camera
Reviews.Author: Denise
Reviews.Content: This camera is fantastic. After years of taking pics that were barely worth printing, this camera makes even me look like I know what I'm doing. The zoom is GREAT. My daughter is a softball pitcher and cheerleader and I can get close-up shots of her right from the bleachers. I haven't even learned how to use all the settings yet but just in the automatic setting, I'm getting super photos. My sister is buying one now too. I will never need to buy another camera.

Reviews.Title: Great affordable camera
Reviews.Author: RJ
Reviews.Content: I have owned a bunch of cameras over the years, but this has easily been the best.  Great zoom, clear and colorful pictures are regular.  Thank you Nikon for producing such a wonderful camera.

Reviews.Title: Super Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: R. RAH
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend this camera.  It's easy to use - plug and play when transfering and loading pictures/video images.  Crisp clear pictures and great overall!

Reviews.Title: like it alot
Reviews.Author: Ann M Williams
Reviews.Content: love  it.  The only thing I didn't like, was that it is a little difficult to figure out all the perks of the camera.  The directions are very vague.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Zachary
Reviews.Content: This was a gift for my mother after she broke her camera (the earlier model in this line actually) and she is quite pleased. The price was the best we could find in stores or online for a NEW one and it was worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Crispin
Reviews.Content: The camera is great and works fine. The picture quality is real good and I must say that this was very good business.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use
Reviews.Author: H. Wasserman "jewelry maven"
Reviews.Content: This camera is a good value. We like the fact that there is little delay from taking picture to picture even with the flash. It is fairly light weight. It would have been nice if this camera had come with its own case. This camera takes good quality pictures.

Reviews.Title: Best camera for the money!
Reviews.Author: Sandy K. Oksen
Reviews.Content: My foreign exchange student needed a new camera and on a recommendation from my Uncle who is a photographer she bought this one. She loved it.

Reviews.Title: my first Nikon
Reviews.Author: Blair Pavlik "civil war nut"
Reviews.Content: have had Canon since tyne '70s and this has features other cameras don't have like both a led screen and a real viewfinder. the optical zoom is great and I have taken some very long shots with great quality.

Reviews.Title: Very good pictures
Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: It takes amazing pictures and we did not need a tripod for the close ups.  A very easy camera to use

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the everyday shooter
Reviews.Author: albert ferradino
Reviews.Content: This is the second Nikon Coolpix I purchased; the first being a Nikon 8700- great camera for the era (2004). However the Nikon P510 has everything I need in a camera, which is a long range optical zoom. This camera will replace my film camera very nicely -- I no longer need to carry a bag of lenses.

Reviews.Title: Poor Quality Pictures/Video?
Reviews.Author: James L. Edwards
Reviews.Content: I was not getting the Quality of Pictures or Video I expected with the Nikon Coolpix P510 Camera I purchased Oct 2012.  So After trying everything I could to help improve my Results, I contacted Nikon Customer Service and they told me that the Transcend 32GB Memory card that came with the Bonus Package that came with the camera was not an approved Card for use with this camera!  They told me to take the card out and take a few Pictures with the internal memory and see how they come out?  Here is a pic from that test:[...]Here is links to a list of Approved Memory Cards for the Nikon Coolpix P510 Camera: Approved Memory Cards - Coolpix P510[...]Reference Manual - Nikon COOLPIX P510For instructions on formatting your memory card: open the link below, press and hold Ctrl+F on your keyboard, type "format memory"[...]I have ordered: 2 x SanDisk Extreme 16 GB SDHC Class 10 UHS-1 Flash Memory Card 45MB/s SDSDX-016G-X46Will let you know how they work?

Reviews.Title: Best camera eve?
Reviews.Author: Selwyn Wilson "grandy"
Reviews.Content: I have had many, many cameras, digital and others and this b y far beats all I have ever had, especially for the money.

Reviews.Title: Good, with a manual in portuguese language.
Reviews.Author: Carlos De Freitas
Reviews.Content: The camera it's one of best options in the Market, but I had to pay high brazilian tax. I would like to knew about that.

Reviews.Title: An excellent digital camera at a reasonable price
Reviews.Author: C. Wilsey
Reviews.Content: After my old Kodak digital camera died I looked at several new ones and finally chose this Nikon camera as its replacement.  I have had Nikon cameras in the past and liked them so I gave this one a chance.  It is small enough to take traveling anywhere, is simple to operate, takes great pictures and is reasonably priced.  What more could you ask?

Reviews.Title: Great features on a small camera
Reviews.Author: Bruce A Shirey
Reviews.Content: I like that I get almost all functions of a DSLR in a compact camera and it's functions are similar to my Nikon point and shoot. I like having a view finder which when shooting action it is much easier to follow the action.  I have not used the new camera much yet but will soon be working on a project that will test what it can do.  This camera was ordered instead of the new P520 because I liked the tilting view screen better on the older model.

Reviews.Title: Nice unit
Reviews.Author: GaryLL
Reviews.Content: I have not really tested it out yet.  But I love the size.  It fits nicely into the hand.  The telephoto is incredible.  If you want to shoot things that you can barely see - this would be a good choice.  If you want an any situation camera without a lot of equipment, the 510 is a good choice.It still freaks me out to get only a digital manual.I really needed the manual - there is just a lot of stuff that this camera can do and some not (at least for me) very intiutive buttons and pathways.This is a real high tec camera that should really meet most of your needs (unless you want a point-and-shoot), although they auto setting is pretty close to point and shoot.I bought Nikon because I have always had good luck with them.

Reviews.Title: Serving as our organizational camera!
Reviews.Author: Stephen Saporito
Reviews.Content: I work for a small non-profit and I purchased this camera for our organization to use to document our events and take photos for publicity purposes (to use on our website, emails and in our newsletter). We have been using this camera for a few months now and by a variety of people and we've been very happy with the quality of photographs that we have taken with the camera. We have also used the camera to take videos that have come out great - much better than I expected. Overall, we've been very happy with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great, affordable camera
Reviews.Author: R. Noonan
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my wife to replace her digital camera that we just were not happy with for image quality.  So far, it has exceeded our expectations for image quality and neat features.  The zoom is just amazing.  I saw some problems with battery life, but so far we really haven't had any problems with it, including days when my wife has take hundreds of pictures.  Now my big problem is needing more memory cards since my wife (and daughter) are taking pictures like crazy.  They are constantly getting compliments on the quality of the pictures, and everyone thinks the selective color feature is cool.The camera also has performed great taking low light pictures.  Poor low light performace was one thing my wife really hated about the old camera, so she is really pleased with this.So far, I can't think of any cons for the camera.  I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: I love this camera
Reviews.Author: Manmeet Rawat
Reviews.Content: It is a wonderful experience for photography. This camera is amazing and simply easy to use. It will differentiate those colors also  which are tough to differentiate with our naked eye. I simply love this camera and recommend to everybody.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I was very happy with purchase I bought two. One for my son. Takes great pics!  I bought it for still shots, but I think video is good too!

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: silvia g.
Reviews.Content: I new the product , because my sister has oneI recieved in time, and correctlyExcellent imagesEasy to useI recomend the seller

Reviews.Title: WOW
Reviews.Author: Robert Garman "Kathleen Garman"
Reviews.Content: Received this camera from my husband for my birthday. I have been making jewelry for 24 years & have never been able to photograph it properly.  This camera does it all,loaded with great features.

Reviews.Title: Refurbished Camera with a lot of modern features
Reviews.Author: Steven D. Beste "StedBest"
Reviews.Content: The camera reminds me of my old Nikon Coolpix 5700 that I love and still own. Same body type and control placement but so much more. The P510 offers both adequate LED display and a convenient color viewfinder. The photos are comparable to my SLR in quality. The shooting speed is slower but the functions for different photo subjects are comparable. I like the P510 because it's a grab and shoot with a lot premium features that cost so much more in a SLR camera but in a  convenient package that ready to go. Also, the zoom is excellent.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: isabel moreno
Reviews.Content: Nice camera........ i love the zoom .i can take perfect pictures .. i love the size.. everything with it is perfect.

Reviews.Title: Best Camera In this price range that I've owned
Reviews.Author: K. Slater
Reviews.Content: I didn't want to go with a DSLR camera. I tried two other camera brands before this one and replaced them both before getting this one. I wish I started with this one. You can get amazing pictures with this, and the zoom is incredible. Tons of features too.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: bnpruitt
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. I purchased this camera to replace one that had broken recently. It takes great quality pictures, zooms in really nice, and has tons of features. My favorite feature is the panorama mode. I will say that while I love everythng  about it it can be difficult to navigate at times so I wouldnt recommend it for a new user.

Reviews.Title: Best Camera I ever owned
Reviews.Author: Jimmy Hage "Snowman"
Reviews.Content: Being a great fan of Nikon superzooms, I have owned the 8080, P80, P90, P100, P500 and the P510. They're all great cams but the P510 is the king. Excellent quality pics, great videos. I use it to photogrpah wildlife so the built in GPS is a wonder. Great built in HDR. Use it for birdwatching and was able to create breathtaking photos without the hassle and bulkiness of DSLR's and their expensive telephoto lenses. The camera is a fit-in-pocket telescope. I ll be looking forward to buy the next superzoom from Nikon. No wonder why the P510 is rated number 1 in users ratings in the point and shoot category on Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Nikon P510
Reviews.Author: Robert Levy
Reviews.Content: Nikon P510 shot some pictures did look neat and clear. Nice function operation. We will have more time to use them and will be update review.overall great

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: UniqueladyG
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera last week, to take pictures at my Grandsons wedding, I own a cannon rebel TGi 3, but just did not want to do all the work involved in using it, , I was very pleased with my Nikon, was not a maor diference in Nikon verses my very expensive Cannon . Nikon is very users friendly also. I did not use the video so I cannot comment on that. . It deserves a 5 star'

Reviews.Title: take beautiful pictures
Reviews.Author: JoEllen Buck
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. It takes beautiful pictures and I've not had any problems with it. I recommend it to everyone

Reviews.Title: Good camera but has delay when it starts
Reviews.Author: Ying Chen
Reviews.Content: I bought it just weeks before my cruise to Alaska. This is a fairly easy camera to learn to use it and the picture is very good! Only set back is that when I turned on the camera, it would take maybe 5 to 10 seconds to start, By the time I spot an animal during excursion to the time to shoot the picture, this time delay is quite significant. I didn't try much video function. But overall, this is a very good camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Robert Watson
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my wife.  We were skeptical because we have a Nikon Coolpix L18 and it sucks.This camera is nothing like the L18, though.  It is great!It takes pictures fast and they are clear, with the exception of motion shots.  Those are sometimes blurry.We are still learning about all this camera can do.  It is smarter than we are, I am afraid.I would definitely recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: A descent Bridge Camera.
Reviews.Author: Sudhakar Mishra
Reviews.Content: I guess most of the reviews over here give a fair idea of the Pros & Cons of this Camera.I'd say its an awesome add on camera if you're in a hurry & cannot afford to bag your SLR kit (which occupies large space). This camera gives you the freedom from carrying multiple lenses (of course it comes at the cost of the picture quality but you can live with it).It clicks very nice & beautiful shots if you know how to use the manual settings, needless to say that the Scene mode has some very useful presets, which, I've used to click a few of my best shots.I'd recommend this camera for beginners & enthusiasts as well. It will give you a good head start & enthusiasts will have a good add on/ready to go camera.Overall, an excellent point and shoot with some SLR level qualities (which include the quick focus system & good manual controls). The only CON that i could find was that you cannot shoot RAW (Panasonic gives you that option) & no BULB mode, but then again, we are not even close to Pro SLR, so, five out of five.Happy clicking...Cheers.

Reviews.Title: Great Zoom!
Reviews.Author: Joe046 "Joe"
Reviews.Content: Really like this Camera.  Bought it for it's 42x zoom and of course it is a Nikon.Some of the features are a bit complicated and could be better documented.  Still getting to know the cmera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Susan Emery
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my son and he adores it. Great pictures and wonderful features. Would recommend it to everyone. Has so many features the more expensive cameras have.

Reviews.Title: Cristofer Burgos
Reviews.Author: Cristofer Burgos
Reviews.Content: Me gusto mucho era exactamente lo que esperaba es una  buena camara HD Se la recomiendo, Nikon COOLPIX P510 16.1 MP CMOS Digital Camera with 42x Zoom NIKKOR ED...

Reviews.Title: Well pleased
Reviews.Author: Vince Stevens
Reviews.Content: I like the long lenses cameras. This is my second one. The first one is a Kodak Z981 Nice camera,but has problem with certain colors of red and the video is noisy when zooming. The P510  has a lot of features you see on more expensive digital slrs.. I have not shot any video with this camera yet. Not really interested in video. I just want good pictures. So far I'm well pleased. It has a lot of different shooting modes and the menus are easy to navigate. I do most of my shooting in low light. I try to capture as much natural light as possible. So far all the bad pictures I got were my own doing not the camera. I'm not a tall person and the fact the screen tips out is nice if you are in a crowd just tip out the screen stick up your arm focus and shoot. If your to the point of wanting more out of a camera and not sure if you want to go for a full digital slr.the camera has a lot of features for the money.

Reviews.Title: Great camera and easy to use
Reviews.Author: Karen
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera 2 weeks before I left on a trip to Africa.  I was a little worried that I wouldn't be able to have it all figured out before this "trip of a lifetime" but to my surprise it is quite easy to use.  There were several people on our safari with big zoom lenses that were very heavy.  I got may fabulous shots that rivaled what they got with much more expensive and awkward equipment.  I also have small hands and this is easy to grip.  I also love that it was red and stands out from everyone else's camera.  Great quality and features for the price.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Moon Shots
Reviews.Author: Mary Cox
Reviews.Content: I've been looking for a camera that could take awesome shots of the moon and this one was it.  It shows the craters of the moon and focuses right into it.  I love love this camera.  I posted a picture on Earth and Skys Facebook and they added it to their timeline and I have over 500 likes on that photo.  https://www.facebook.com/EarthSky

Reviews.Title: Need of a reliable camera!
Reviews.Author: Hershel Taylor
Reviews.Content: Going to Alaska and the need of a camera that will meet all of my expectations.  Will be taking several 100  photos and with this camera I will be able to keep the wonderful scenes for the rest of my life.  I love it!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: C. Child
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera for a bargain! it has lots of nice features and special effects! I would recommend it to anyone who wants a good quality camera at a low price.

Reviews.Title: This carmera is just what we wanted.
Reviews.Author: Anthony J. Benik
Reviews.Content: This camera takes pictures much faster than my previous camera.  It does better in speed shooting situations.  It may not have the focus accuracy of my old camera, but it makes up for that in the fact that I usually missed more moments because of a slow shooting response than I do now in an out of focus shot.Overall 4 out of 5.PS: I bought mine used from someone with good ratings and paid almost one-third less.  It still works great.

Reviews.Title: pERFECT!
Reviews.Author: Stephanie D.
Reviews.Content: The camera is perfect for me, I love it.I recommend it to anyone who is fan of taking photos but isn't a professional.thanks

Reviews.Title: GRRRRReat camera!
Reviews.Author: Mary
Reviews.Content: This camera does everything---and with ease. I take LOTS of baseball pics and they turn out perfect! Plus....the red color is awesome! Absolutely LOVE it!!

Reviews.Title: Very nice Camera!!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Its the best camera you can buy for this price... has every option you'll ever need.Cons: -You need to center human faces in the middle of the photo, otherwise it will stretch faces.- HD video quality is nice, but zooming in & out with no enough light will make it impossible to auto-focus!!! and you'll need to start shooting again..

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Matias
Reviews.Content: The product arrived in good condition. It is my first camera. Have a very nice zoom and the photos qualities are very good too. I am happy with the purchased. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera for wildlife
Reviews.Author: ScudAg56
Reviews.Content: The 42X zoom on this camera will blow away the long lenses you used to lug around, at least for magnification. I have taken pictures of subjects in the distance with and without max zoom. In the non-zoomed photo, you see nothing but a hillside, in the zoomed in photo, you see a cowboy herding horses in great detail. Camera does have issues with subject in motion (wants to take multiple photos when using Sport setting) and I have difficulty getting it to focus on small distant objects like the Moon, even on Infinity setting - although I have seen amazing pictures taken of planets with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Just what we were looking for.
Reviews.Author: opierod6000
Reviews.Content: We have two small children who take part in a number of different activities so we were looking for a solid camera with great zooming in capabilities to take pictures that were good enough for framing.  This fit the bill to a tee!  the camera is extremely easy to operate, extremely light weight and contains utilizes amazing zoom in functionality.  The wife really enjoys this and we take it with us wherever we go.

Reviews.Title: Jury is out
Reviews.Author: Hugh V. Hansen
Reviews.Content: The camera (refurbished by Nikon, sold by Electronic Deals, fulfilled by Amazon) just arrived and is charging, so no review of performance yet, BUT: whoever puts the parts in the box in this situation (Nikon? Electronic Deals?) put in the lens cover for a different model number, and it doesn't fit. The correct model number is "unavailable, don't know when it will be restocked" on Amazon, though available from other vendors. Amazon has given me "store credit", but of course that's of limited use until/unless they restock.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Jamie Gurvitch
Reviews.Content: The product came it perfectly and fast, and I love it. I will have a great time using it in the future.

Reviews.Title: Great pictures, great product
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: It is a great product with a great price. I like pictures that this camara take are amazing. I recommend this camara to those we want to feel like profesional taking pictures

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Camera
Reviews.Author: Peter
Reviews.Content: The camera's picture quality was not very good during the first few weeks of usage. After taking over 100 pictures, I was able to change settings to fit the light condition for taking different pictures. Therefore, the camera is working great now. I gave this camera a 4-star because of a small defective part on image quality, but it's still a recommended purchase on Amazon.

Reviews.Title: excellent camera and excellent deal
Reviews.Author: todd a morrison
Reviews.Content: quick shipping product was as described.I would by this again. excellent deal you wont find a better camera for the money

Reviews.Title: fast and responsible delivery
Reviews.Author: sertge
Reviews.Content: Got the camera on time and it's awesome, the quality surpassed my expectations, the hd recording is very large, completely recommended

Reviews.Title: coolpix P510
Reviews.Author: shana R.
Reviews.Content: I researched for quite a while, and even though this camera was considered an old model, I purchased it at a great price and it is perfect for what I need.  The videos are very clear and sound is great, and the pictures are great for a point and shoot. I am still getting used to the settings, but I love this camera!

Reviews.Title: Nikon COOLPIX P510 16.1 MP CMOS Digital Camera with 42xZoom NIKKOR ED
Reviews.Author: JMP
Reviews.Content: Though I still have a lot to learn about this camera, I have been pleased with the shots I have taken so far. I like the integrated zoom lens so I don't have to carry extra equipment. It seems to be quite user friendly.

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: mmacal
Reviews.Content: Absolutely what I was looking for in a point and shoot camera.  The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because the user's manual is on CD only.  My computer does not have one so to learn how to use different features I need to search the internet.  It does take fantastic pictures and when you zoom in really close the pictures are still very clear.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Andrew
Reviews.Content: This camera takes great pics. I did a lot of research and I couldn't be happier. It was between this and the comparable Canon. I went with this based on the reviews.

Reviews.Title: me encanta
Reviews.Author: luis carlos
Reviews.Content: I love the sharpness and image quality.buy accessories that allow us unique maneuverability.good resolution of image and video quality.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Natalie Prathaftakis
Reviews.Content: I love the clear pictures, the great zoom and the crisp video that the camera takes.  Looking forward to trying out the gps when on vacation.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: pepper
Reviews.Content: I always wanted a Nikon Camera and I pick a outstanding on.  It does everything want to do and then some

Reviews.Title: More than I expected
Reviews.Author: George Robert Vierkant
Reviews.Content: P510 appears to have more functionality than I had expected. I am anxious to use it when traveling.  There are some functions that I may not use.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera
Reviews.Author: kathy hill
Reviews.Content: I was told by a pro that this was all the camera I would ever need and he was sooo right.  I took amazing photos in China after a brief week of practice.  The camera is simple and intuitive to use as well as comfortable in my hand.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: MandyW
Reviews.Content: The camera is perfect and does everything I need it to do.  It is easy to use as well and my battery lasts a long time

Reviews.Title: Best Zoom, god pictures
Reviews.Author: Cristian Metzger
Reviews.Content: Very good quality and beautifull desing. A lot of features. The only downside is granular pictures when you zoom in the resultant picture.

Reviews.Title: Camera purchase
Reviews.Author: M. Pennella

Reviews.Title: Great, semi-pro camera
Reviews.Author: MickOfield
Reviews.Content: I have used this for test shots so far. The only problem I see is the auto focus is slow to "zero-in" compared to other cameras. The exceptional focal length of the telephoto lens is amazing, great for wildlife shots. With the lens set to max wide angle, there is no vignetting. The "scene" function covers most scenarios you are likely to find and offers the "correct" tonal adjustments for them.The Nikon website is extremely poor in that there are few accessories offered for this camera. The camera bag offered is barely large enough, go to Walmart and buy a generic one at a fraction of the price.All in all this camera has all the advantages of a SLR with none of the disadvantages like having to carry lenses and getting dust on the sensor.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price.
Reviews.Author: Eric W Jacobson
Reviews.Content: I have several digital Nikon SLR's and like them all, but this little camera has worked great for me this fall and winter. I'm a avid hunter and like to pack a camera with me, I've found that most cameras are not practical to carry while hunting. Some are to big and heavy, the smaller ones do not have the quality of pictures I like. This fall I was able to take several hundred pictures of wildlife that are amazing. In the past I would have to pack so much equipment to get great pictures that it was not enjoyable. This camera has made taking pictures while hunting fun again. It is light and has a great zoom. I do not like the on/off button because I'm used to the location on my other cameras. It takes a moment to power up so you can miss a shot if you are not ready.  I thought that the sound of the cameras zoom would scare the animals, but in the 20-30 ft range I never had a animal know that I was there. I like to use the view finder over the LCD screen, and have found that its not as nice as my bigger Nikons. The price of this camera is nice, it costs less than buying a lens for my other cameras. I wish I could attach filters to this camera. The battery life could be greater, I just carry a couple extra batteries with me and haven't had a problem. I did buy a separate charger and wish Nikon would include one with the camera purchase. I have used this camera in adverse weather, down to -15 degrees F. And in winter blizzards , it has worked flawlessly.

Reviews.Title: It's Good, Now Fix IT, Please.
Reviews.Author: Robert G. "Robert"
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with the quality of photos produced by this camera particularly hand held at the maximum zoom (1000mm equivalent). I owned a P-100 previously and I think there is a considerable optical improvement at the higher focal lenghts. However, the inability of the P-510 to focus on some subjects was maddening. It would go through the focus process passing right through perfect focus only to stop out of focus. It would do this sometimes on a completely isolated subject.  Also the camera mysteriously lost it's access to the main menu screen. I hoped that Nikon would be able to provide a firmware re-install but they could not and said that I would have to return if for service. You might have noted that I tend to speak of the camera in the past tense--it was aggressively stolen from me here in friendly Costa Rica where I have been using it for the past 2 months. So Nikon lost the opportunity to troubleshoot this camera and I lost the use of a compromised but functional camera for 2 months.When I return to the USA I plan to have another waiting for me and hope Nikon is diligently working on the problems I have spoken of.

Reviews.Title: As good as advertised

Reviews.Content: Not a camera junkie but you'll see that those that are rate this camera very highly.  I've had it for 3 weeks now and I would have to agree.  Great pictures.  Easy settings, advanced settings if you want.  Takes great close up pictures, the long zoom is incredible, the 120 and 60 frames per second shots are awesome, panoramas are made easy (just click once then pan the camera either 180 or 360 degrees and the camera does the rest).  Get the extra batteries and charger, well worth it.  Very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Great zoom, sharp photos
Reviews.Author: LAM
Reviews.Content: I had read great reviews on the Nikon P510 and didn't originally buy it because it does not have RAW format.  My brother purchased one, and I was impressed with the photos, and envious of the long zoom.  I bought the Nikon P510 when it was on sale Thanksgiving Day.  Photos taken at a basketball game from the higher level seats were sharp, great zoom.  Very little processing needed for the zoom or regular photos, great quality.  The only negatives so far (1) no RAW format, (2) Panoramic with the easy scanning does not allow zooming, have to do the panoramic with the wide angle (versus the Fujifilm HS30 EXR that allows zoom with the panoramic scanning),  and (3) the P510 doesn't seem to allow a still photo to be taken with video (that I can tell / this is another function the HS30 EXR has).  Still, love the Coolpix P510 photo quality and the long zoom!  If the RAW format is not something desired, and panoramics are not so important - this is a great camera.
